results.description:
PICK-UP CO-ED SOCCER GAMES @ CHELSEA PARK  

                                     Check our Facebook page:

          facebook.com/ManhattanInternationalCoedSoccer


                                NO CLEATS OR STUDS ALLOWED

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=cR_TuiCA8RM

GAME DESCRIPTION:

Our games are for all levels and people that prefer to play a non-competitive game of soccer, break a sweat while exercising running up and down the field with the ball and all this happening in a very laid-back and non-judgmental environment. Please, arrive 10 minutes before the game so we can get the teams set up.

Game Format:

We'll play three simultaneous games of 8 on 8, with small goals. There will be 6 teams on the field and we will play THREE games, 30 minutes/game. Every 30 minutes we will have a short break and teams will switch to play against different team. Please check our meetup message board on Friday night or before 12.00 pm on Saturday to see what team you are on. This will save us a lot of time on the field.

RULES OF THE GAME:

First and most important rule of the game is to have fun and enjoy the time on the field! Rough play and offensive language will absolutely not be tolerated!!! In plain words, no slide tackling, no pushing and no telling off.

No power shots allowed. No power shots means; you can shoot the ball but not as hard as you can. This doesn't mean that you can not take the shot at all. Kicking the ball or taking the shot on the goal, is of course allowed.

***If you don't sign up for the game, do not show up.***

If you are late for the game, you must wait until the game in progress is over to join your team.

Those that don't comply with these rules, will kindly be asked to leave the field so others can enjoy the game and maybe a two game ban.

Any other questions regarding the rules of the game or anything else, should be directed to the organizer directly or to the assistant organizer/s!!!

Location:

CHELSEA PARK.

Between 27th and 28th street and 10th Avenue.

Take A, C or E to 23rd St and 8th Ave and walk to 10th Ave and 27th St or any subway line to 34th St and Penn Station and walk for about 8 minutes to 28th St and 10th Ave.

What to bring with you:

A pair of sneakers, indoor or turf shoes, shin guards (recommended) and lots of water. There is a water fountain next to the park if you need extra water.

Fee:

You will be asked to pay $9.25 when you RSVP. This $9.25 is used to pay for, facilities permits, meetup fees, Amazon fees, goals, cones, soccer balls etc.

Refunds & Weather Policy:

Refunds will be issued if the RSVP is changed by Wednesday before 12.00PM or if the game is cancelled. The game can be cancelled if the weather conditions are severe like heavy rain, snow or thunder.

After the game we'll go to Molly Wee for a pint or two:

                             Molly Wee Restaurant

                                       402 8th Ave, 

                                 New York, NY 10001

                                    (212)[masked]

                            PLEASE CHECK THEIR MENU!

                                      themollywee.com

PARTICIPATING IN MANHATTAN-INTERNATIONAL-COED-SOCCER ACTIVITIES AGREEMENT:

I certify that I have no known medical or other conditions that could interfere with my participation in Manhattan-International-COED-Soccer activities. I also understand and accept that the practice of soccer, both indoor and outdoor, involves certain risks of physical injury. Therefore, I, individually, hereby release and discharge, Manhattan-International-COED-Soccer Organizer and Assistant Organizers from any and all claims, actions, damages, losses, liabilities, costs and expenses of any kind whatsoever, including but not limited to any claims of negligence, arising out of, resulting from, by reason of, or in connection with my participation in any of Manhattan-International-COED-Soccer programs or activities. Manhattan-International-COED-Soccer Organizer and its Assistant Organizers reserve the right to take and utilize photographs, video, or any type of recording of participating person while engaged in our or associated activities. I consent to Manhattan-International-COED-Soccer use the photograph, video, or recording of me, for advertising, promotional, or related purposes, and waive all rights to compensation and other rights which may arise as a result.

Georgio’s of Gramercy
27 East 21st (Broadway and PAS)
Sunday, October 25th
5:15 pm optional drinks, 6:15-8pm dinner
$79 3-course meal, glass wine, coffee, t&t.

One of the higher rated restaurants in Gramercy, this 14-year old, Zagat 23 is “The epitome of a true sleeper, this longtime Italian-American class act in the Flatiron features consistently good cooking that suggests unsung talent in the kitchen.” 4.5 stars on Tripadvisor and NY Magazine, they write, “Giorgio’s exterior has all the trappings of exclusivity, but step inside this Gramercy standout and behind thick velvet curtains is a warm interior of beige and burgundy that backs a sophisticated and inviting scene as the diverse crowd generates a convivial buzz. Still, it’s the kitchen’s creations that leave the strongest impressions.” Our menu includes, but is not limited to: tuna tartar, New York strip, Berkshire pork chop, sea scallops, grilled chicken capellini and their popular and delicious s’more’s bread pudding.

results.description:
Getting into our Right Mind: The Practice of Meditation
with Alex Bonano

At the moment, we do not recognize the vast potential of the mind.  We relate to a mind that feels stuck in negativity, and we experience the world as a place of problems and suffering that we can do little to change. But when we experience our mind directly we discover that it has a limitless potential, and is capable of limitless love, wisdom and joy. By going deep into the heart and connecting to the limitless potential of the mind, we will discover we have the power to free ourselves from negativity, and to change our experience of the world.Sept 13:    The Wonders of the Mind


Sept 20:  The Peaceful Nature of the Mind
Sept 27:   Limitless Mind, Limitless Potential
Oct 4:       Getting into the Heart

results.description:
Futsal Pick up games (intermediate to advanced level)

Fee: $10 dollars per player per game; pay through paypal.

Only 10 players per game, no subs. One game is 55-60 minutes. Be early. Every player rotates as a Goalie for 6 minutes, timed it with an electronic scoreboard. We play without a break. Regulation size goals with nets. Futsal ball. Please make sure to bring a white and a red t-shirt, indoor shoes. Games are competitive, but friendly. Please keep in mind that these games are definitely not for the beginners. 

Please no fouls, zero tolerance to this. “Futsal is not a physical but a technical game ”. Minimum physical contact means fewer injuries and no violence. No charging, no displacing with your arms or body to gain the position on the ball. No running into the opponent. Play the ball, not the player. Time it, don’t foul it. 

Refunds will be honored only with a minimum of 24 hour cancelation.  No refunds for late cancelations; no exceptions. 

The school entrance is located on East 109th street between 2nd and 3rd avenues (near 2nd avenue) on the south side of the street. You'll see a row of 5-6 metal doors. Open the door or ring the buzzer (on your right) and someone will open the door for you.

For questions,  use the MEETUP message and notifications tools. 

Post pictures and videos at:

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/Futsalacrossamerica?ref=hl

Twitter: https://twitter.com/FutsalAcrossA

Thank you for being part of Futsal Across America.

Enjoy the game!

results.description:
Questions for discussion (Thank you, Karen)

 1. At the beginning of the story, Amelia says she is considering quitting online dating. How would you compare the act of buying books online to the act of dating online? Is it relevant to the story that Amelia meets her eventual husband in a very analog location, a bookstore? 

2. Consider the setting. Why do you think the author chooses to set the book on an island? How does the island setting reflect A.J.’s character?

 3. Perhaps oddly, vampires are a recurring motif in the story: for example, when A.J.’s wife throws the vampire prom and when A.J. watches True Blood to court Amelia. What do you make of the references to vampires? 

4. Lambiase moves from an occasional or nonreader, to a reader, to a bookseller. How do you think becoming a reader changes him? Consider the scene where he decides not to confront Ismay about the backpack. Do you think Lambiase’s reaction is different than it would have been if he hadn’t taken up reading? 

5. The author chooses to begin each chapter with a description of a short story. Discuss some of the ways the stories relate to the chapters with which they are paired. Is A.J. creating a canon for Maya? How does the book itself function as a kind of canon? If these are A.J.’s favorites, what do they say about A.J. as a reader and as a man?

 6. Did you find Ismay’s motivations for stealing Tamerlane to be forgivable? How do you think she should pay for her crime? Why do you think Lambiase lets her off?

 7. At one point, Maya speculates that perhaps “your whole life is determined by what store you get left in” (page 85). Is it the people or the place that makes the difference? 

8. When did you become aware that Leon Friedman might be an imposter? What did you make of Leonora Ferris's reasons for hiring him?

 9. How do you think Daniel Parrish might have changed if he had lived? Do you think some people never change? 

10. Were you surprised by the outcome of the short story contest? What do you think of A.J.’s comments to Maya about why certain books and stories win prizes and others don’t? Does the knowledge that a book has won a prize attract you to reading it?

11. Compare Maya’s "fiction" about the last day of her mother’s life to Ismay’s version. Which do you consider to be more accurate and why?

12. How do you think the arrival of the e-reader is related to the denouement of the story? Is A.J. a man who cannot exist in a world with e-books? What do you think of e-books? Do you prefer reading in e- or on paper? 

13. On page 159, A.J. asks Maya, “Is a twist less satisfying if you know it’s coming? Is a twist that you can’t predict symptomatic of bad construction?” What do you think of this statement in view of the plot of The Storied Life of A. J. Fikry? Did you guess who Maya's father was? If so, what were the clues?

14. The author chooses to end the novel with a new sales rep coming to an Island Books that is no longer owned by A.J. What do you make of this ending? 

15. What do you think the future holds for physical books and bookstores?

results.description:
The Adventures of Augie March is a picaresque novel by Saul Bellow, published in 1953 by Viking Press. It features the eponymous Augie March who grows up during the Great Depression and it is an example of bildungsroman, tracing the development of an individual through a series of encounters, occupations and relationships from boyhood to manhood.

The Adventures won the 1954 U.S. National Book Award for Fiction.[1] Both Time magazine and the Modern Library Board named it one of the hundred best novels in the English language.[2][3]
results.name: "The Adventures of Augie March" by Saul Bellow

group.name: The Moderns:  The Modern Library 100 Greatest Book Club

results.description:
New Swing Dance Session With Spencer @ The JCC in Manhattan

334 Amsterdam Avenue, New York, NY @76th street

 with  Spencer Weisbond

Six week, progressive session

  102: Advanced Beginner -  7:30 -8:30pm Advance in Jitterbug and East Coast Swing by learning more involved patterns with harder footwork. Build your dance vocabulary and partnering skills. This class is the prerequisite for Lindy Hop (level 3), which is the grandfather of all swing dances and has 8-count patterns. No partner needed


  103: Lindy Hop﻿ Pre-Intermediate 8:30- 9:30pm
Bring all your moves together into complete sequences. Learn new eight-count patterns to make your dance more intricate and expressive.  

  Teacher: Spencer Weisbond please call me with questions about your level[masked]
Level one is now on Wednesday nights!
  Register and pricing below:

  Level 102:  http://ebiz.jccmanhattan.org/personifyebusiness/Programs/ProgramDetail.aspx?pid=633153420</a>

Level 103: http://ebiz.jccmanhattan.org/personifyebusiness/Programs/ProgramDetail.aspx?pid=634125361<a href="http://ebiz.jccmanhattan.org/personifyebusiness/Programs/ProgramDetail.aspx?pid=631567294">

</a>

Spencer has been dancing swing since 1998. He has studied Lindy hop extensively with 4 time world champion and 8 time American champion, Nathalie Gomes. Spencer had led the outreach program for Hop Swing And & Jump dance studios at local venues around NYC.
Spencer has had his own program in swing at the JCC in Manhattan for over 8 years, and also teaches privately. He has taught for Lincoln Center’s “Midsummer Night Swing” He currently organizes the New York City Swing Dance Meetup Group, which has over 3400 members, making it one of the most active swing dance clubs in the world. Spencer also co-founded the popular NYC dance  event “Swing Remix”. <a href="http://www.SwingRemix.com">www.SwingRemix.com </a>

<a href="http://ebiz.jccmanhattan.org/personifyebusiness/Programs/ProgramDetail.aspx?pid=135408">

Hey Guys,

The 5v5 Indoor Co-Ed is back, matches start Nov 12th.


This is pre-season signup: 10% early bird offer ends October 25th! Details and Registration at:


http://www.group-stage.com/futsal-5-a-side/


Located at one of the best gyms in Brooklyn! We use Futsal rules, i.e, a heavier ball and walls are not in play. All players receive team jerseys and post game drink specials at a local bar. It's a 7 min walk from Atlantic Center subway, or 4 min from C train subway.


DETAILS:

• Teams are 5v5, max roster 10 players


• 8 game minimum


•  45min matches, unlimited subs

• Players receive GSF T-shirt


•  Finalists awarded medals

•  1 female player required during matches


•  Drinks specials at a local bar

REGISTRATION:


1. FREE AGENT: $126* Register here.


2. TEAM: $1125* Register here.


Free-Agents that want to be on the same team as friends, just let us know in the comments section. 

*10% Early Bird ends Oct 25th.



Note: If you don't have enough players for a team, let us know and we'll add players to round out the roster. If you would like to be on a specific team let us know in the comment section. No games over the holiday period (Thanksgiving, Christmas & New Year.)


See you soon, the Footy Fanatics!


Grand FC / Group Stage FC

results.description:
Great Meetup this sunday! It was good to see everyone, i like that alot of people met each other. Were doing this again this sunday but back to the 8pm show, the club wasnt too happy that there were so many of us in the bar for so long and it makes sense. I dont have the lineup yet but i will update it as i get it tomorrow. See you then! Were gonna continue doing this as long as the club lets us.

This is a special Meetup, we finally got a deal with Stand Up New York the hottest club in New York City to let us in free of charge and see comics like Amy Shumer, Godfrey, Kevin Brennan and top names, this is NOT an amateur show like alot of the meetups. I just ask that everyone who Rsvp's really do their best to show up AND MAKE IT ON TIME. as you know I dont charge for this meetup so come out see the hottest comedy show and maybe even make some new friends. this sundays line up includes the below.

Ari Shaffir, Gregory K. Nick Griffin, Greer Barnes, Godfrey, Christian Finnegan, Jon Laster, Dean Edwards and pretty much any comic you see on Comedy Central these days drops by and shows up on the lineup who knows who might drop by usually its Amy Shumer or Judah Friedlander.

I will be at the front end of the bar by the iphone charger as usual to meet with everyone and give you tickets for free admission and have everyone sit together so we can all share laughs. Try to be early the show starts at 8 and everyone sits at same table but i do this earlier so all of you can meet your fellow meetup members. This is a 2 show ticket, so if you show up for the 8 you can stay for the ten also which has a different but also comedy central lineup. Or if you would like to come for the 10 you can just say meetup at the door and they will point you to me.

It's that time of year again where we check in on Rick Grimes and his rag tag crew of survivors.  Who will make it out this year?  Who will die and who will join the team!  

Come on out and see what happens at this year:

                                                Walking Dead 
                                                     Season 6 

Lets root for our guys to survive and see what crazy adventures in this post-apoctiliptic world! 

We will also be joined by an awesome crew, Divisi6n! Lets welcome our fellow walking dead fans for a fun filled night!

Schedual: 

8:00pm - Arrive, socialize and theorize

9:00pm - Watch the new episode! 


10:00pm - Chill, chat and debrief on the crazy things that happened in the episode

Food/Drink - Bar has full food and drink menu

results.description:
We've planned this now as a weekly meetup, so that everyone in the group can get together even if the moderator can't be there.

If Darren can't make it to introduce everyone (he can't this week), could someone please take it upon themselves to 1) stake out the big table a little early, 2) Lead a go-around-the-horn o? introductions at 8pm, and 3) Time the 60 minutes of writing time and let everyone know when it's 9 pm.

As always,

Please RSVP only if you can make it, and update as soon as possible if your plans change. We have had far too many no-shows.

You will see progress in your writing project by spending the minimum of a single hour per week on it. This is your practice/focus time, so I hope to see you there.

Join other writers for an hour of focused writing!

7-8 pm - Show up early, stake out a spot and either socialize or get a jump on writing.
8:00 - Start. Introductions, and we'll share what we're working on
8:05 - Get down to business. An hour of silence and solid writing!
9:05- Brief follow up. People are encouraged to share experiences & ideas, network or take off as they like. Feel free to keep writing if you've got the momentum going! Be aware Argo closes at 10pm.
If you're spending too much time THINKING about writing, come and join us for a session of focused writing. It may just be "pipe-cleaning" for now, but you'll feel better showing up at the page. No one will see what you've written or give you unsolicited advice.

WHERE: Argo Tea Cafe, Columbus Circle Subway Station. 1792 Broadway.

SOME TIPS:

Argo has plenty of outlets - we will be on the back, large table.
Seats are hard to come by, and I can only save so many, so please, come on time! If you come late, we might have already started.
The music and occasionally nonmember conversation can be loud, so bring headphones too.
WiFi is available with purchase.
It's a little chilly, so if you get cold bring a sweater.
And it goes without saying that buying a cup of joe or a snack from Argo for being nice enough to host us will bring you good writing karma.
If you aren't sure you can make it, please don't RSVP! Come on time or even a little early, as it can be difficult to save seats.

I am offering an Energy Transmission on Sunday Nights at 10PM, especially for weight loss!

Good nutrition is the core, for good health and successful weight loss, and good energy nutrition is important as well.

This will help you to relax, recharge, replenish, and will help you with stress eating, cravings, and to keep focused, and to feel better about your body and yourself.

A special and delicious vitamin essence, will fill you up with good nutrition, which will help you fill up with the good stuff, therefore you will feel more satisfied with less food, and helps you to absorb the nutrients your body needs.

This will also relax and strengthen your adrenal glands, and help to revitalize all of your glands and organs.

I really hope you enjoy this gift, and if you have any questions  concerns, please let me know.

I will have this each and every Sunday at 10PM! And, in the comfort of your own home.

All you need to do is relax, and intend to receive the Weight Loss Energy Transmission from Jae.

It's that easy, and then you can just relax and enjoy! Do not worry about falling asleep, because the energies work great while you're sleeping. They will work even if you are distracted or if you forget.

All you need to do is to RSVP so that you are on the list.

Please RSVP for each week that want to be included so that I know you're in.

Jae

results.description:
This one workout will keep you amped up all week long. Seriously, give it a try and you will be hooked!


The exercises may change from week to week, but it is always a Tabata-style interval workout: 20 seconds of high intensity work followed by 10 seconds of rest. Then repeat! Exercises include sprints, burpees, squats, situps, box jumps, step ups, pushups, dips, and other “no-frills” exercises.


Warm up beforehand by running, biking, or walking. We start promptly at 6:30 AM and the workout only lasts 31 minutes. Show up a few minutes early to meet people and get yourself pumped up.

results.description:
Every week we will have a different prompt for our weekly photo project.  This week’s theme is Memories.

Each week beginning early Monday morning, you can begin uploading your photos to our meetup album for the week’s theme.  The group won’t actually meet for this event, it’s an individual online challenge for each of you to get your creative juices flowing, share photos in the group, comment and critique each other’s shots, and above all have fun. 

Albums will remain open, so you can upload photos any time after that Monday morning start time but you’ll get the most feedback during the initial week the theme is posted.  You also don’t have to restrict yourself to photos taken during that week for the theme, they can be from past shoots you have done or the weekly prompt can be used to motivate you to shoot something new.
results.name: Weekly Photo Project - Memories

results.description:
Come dip your white cotton, silk and wool yarn, garments and accessories in a natural indigo vat!  Indigo is a totally different technique from other kinds of natural dyeing, and you will see it in action at this meetup.  I will have an active vat ready for dipping and will also be giving a demo at 11:30am showing how to do one yourself and how it all works. Indigo dyeing is a very special technique as the dye is fixed to the fabric by way of oxidization, so when you take your fabric out of the vat it is green and then turns blue when the oxygen in the air hits it.  Come see for yourself.  Shibori tools will be available for making resist patterns in our fabric.

$10 per person

Bring your own natural fibre garments to dye, two pieces per person. They must be washed.

There will be silk scarves and Canadian mule-spun wool yarn for sale for $10 each

Take-home indigo kits will be for sale for $15 each

WEATHER PERMITTING.  If it rains we will try for the following Monday at the same time.

The exact location of the event will be sent to participants a week before the class or when they sign up after that date.
results.name: Indigo Dyeing

results.description:
Join other new mamas at these meetings tailored to moms of newborns up to 12 months old. We'll discuss the ups and downs of life with a newborn/baby -- all aspects of breastfeeding (successes and challenges), the realities of caring for a baby, navigating the new world of parenting, sleeping patterns (or lack thereof) for you and your baby, and much more. But most importantly, the hope is that you will meet other Rivertown/Westchester moms of babies who will become treasured new friends. This is a group for all new mamas, including second-timers and formula-feeding mamas. The group size varies from week to week, but it's typically 6-10 moms. Further information is available here:

http://www.rivertownmamas.com/groups.html

The group operates on a pay-what-you-wish model, and payment is made anonymously (unless paid by credit card). Suggested: $20 per meeting.
results.name: New moms' discussion group

Join this special free LIVE online event from across the world.

With meditation and visualisation, this powerful 30 minute broadcast features beautiful sounds and music to uplift, energise and inspire.

Experience the benefit of the enhanced collective energy of meditating with other people, whilst being in the comfort of your own home or office.

Each meditation includes an introduction, followed by a time in which to meditate in whatever way is easy and natural to you.

You are then guided through a visualisation enabling you to focus on living your ideal life.

Participating Live:

The broadcast begins promptly at 3.00pm and finishes at 3.30pm.

***Please click to join Meditation 101 Live at the scheduled broadcast time ***

Please note that the meditation and visualisation are pre-recorded to ensure sound quality however participation with other people from across the world is live.

Meditation 101 Live works best with the following internet browsers: Internet Explorer, Chrome, Safari and Opera.

If you need any technical help connecting to Meditation 101 Live please click here.

results.description:
Our twice-monthly meeting of business professionals takes place from 4pm - 5pm in a private meeting room at the restaurant.

While there are many ways to make connections with potential new clients, nothing is better than having that prospect's trusted advisor pick up a phone or send an e-mail that says, "Here's someone you need to speak with about that problem you're having".  This is exactly what the members of Smart Transition Group do for each other.  We get to know each other, we get to trust each other, and then we share our most valuable resource... our clients.  

We all want to grow our businesses, but doing it personally, face-to-face, with people you trust and appreciate, makes it faster, easier, and far more effective.  Come learn more as a guest of the group at one of our upcoming meetings.  Bring your best-self, and a stack of business cards.

We'll take an opportunity to introduce ourselves and get to know other members. We will often have a featured member who will expand on the details of their business and help us to understand their buying signs so that we know who to think of when we hear them from our clients.

After a good discussion and a recap of the progress we will retire to the bar at Morton's for a drink and a more relaxed discussion. Some say, that's where the business really happens.

This is a great way to spend some time on a Monday afternoon growing your network and building alliances.
results.name: Monday Meetings at Morton's (The Steakhouse)

group.name: Smart Transition Group - Business Networking that Works

results.description:
NYC LGBTQ Film Festival: "Oriented" - A Documentary

3 Gay Palestinians in Israel Determined to make a change, they form a non-violent, cultural resistance group making viral content for gender and national equality.

Though it may not change the world, sharing their personal struggles helps them to deal with living their multifaceted identities

http://newfest.org/film/oriented/

TICKETS: As of today, tickets were available online for this documentary, but many of the films have sold out, so after RSVPing here, please purchase your tickets directly online at the festival's website: https://web.ovationtix.com/trs/pe/10038199

New York Premiere. Presented in partnership with the JCC.

Jake Witzenfeld, United Kingdom, Israel, 2015, 79 min, in Hebrew and Arabic with English subtitles

This captivating documentary follows three gay Palestinian friends struggling with problems both personal and political.

Fadi feels guilt-ridden about dating a Zionist;

Khader struggles with the desire to leave Israel;

Khaeem worries about coming out to his family.

In Person: Daniel Yankiver, David Lombroso, Associate Producers

results.description:
Route to be determined that day.  This is a fast paced workout and less of a social event due to the cooler temps and earlier sunset.  Due to the potential of hiking in the dark, the group will be limited in size and selective as to whom attends. If you have attended Monday Bear Mountain hikes with me regularly, I will add you. That being said, I reserve the right to remove you if I am not familiar with you or your abilities. If the  questions are not answered, I will also remove you from the going list.

Make sure you have a copy of the map, a headlamp, and minimum 2 liter of water.  If you fall behind during the hike, you must be prepared to finish on your own. Faster hikers are not obligated to wait for slower hikers. You must feel comfortable hiking out on your own should you fall behind. We would love to have everyone join but due the nature of a fast paced event we can not make accommodations for those who are unable to hike independently. This is not mean, it is for your protection as well as the safety of the group. If you are unsure whether or not this is for you, please email me with any questions.

Heavy rain may cancel and would be determined that day if necessary.

HUDSON VALLEY HIKER LEGAL DISCLAIMER  & WAIVER OF LIABILITY

You agree when you sign up for this group or any of the events that you have read and understand the below.

If you join us for a hike (or any other event), please understand that you are responsible for your own preparedness and well-being and will hold no one else liable in case of injury or mishap. You agree not to hold the Organizer, Assistant Organizers, or any other members responsible for any injuries, mishaps, or any other situation that may happen at a planned event. You are responsible to research the event, know the area, and bring the proper gear.

The Hudson Valley Hikers Club does not provide liability insurance for the protection of individuals who may participate in any of the events planned by the Organizer or Assistant Organizers.

This release extends and applies to, and also covers and includes, all unknown, unforeseen, unanticipated and unsuspected injuries, damages, loss and liability.

Your attendance on a hike signifies that you have read and accept the terms of this liability waiver. By signing up for this group or event you understand that you are attending all events AT YOUR OWN RISK. Organizers and Assistant

Organizers of this group are just that, we organize the events and hike together as friends. There are no leaders on these hikes, you are your own leader - This is YOUR hike

results.description:
Please note that our group and our happy hours are not for non-Asians.  

Icebreaker Game Continued: Old Members and New Members Connect!

The icebreaker game for this month will run from 6:30 pm – 7:30 pm as usual.  We are encouraging members to provide information to the organizers, RSVP to attend, and also we are encouraging long term attendance (with older members connecting with newer members).  To play the game, you must have:

1.  RSVPed your attendance through the Meetup.com website BEFORE the day of the event, and

2.  Answered all of Tiffany's questions through Meetup messages or otherwise as to your full name, place of employment, email address, telephone number, and specific Asian background.

The members that joined the group before June 1, 2015 must connect with a member that joined after that date.  The two members must have collectively attended 10 or more NYAPM events.  You must each share one positive anecdote about the group, and one way you think the group can be improved.  Then simply find the organizers for a short quiz to obtain a free drink ticket!

Only the first 25 pairs will get free drinks -- so play efficiently -- although you are always able to use the concept of our games throughout the evening!

-- Our monthly happy hour is our flagship event that started it all years ago in 2005. Experience what it's all about -- come and meet fellow Asian professionals in a friendly, casual atmosphere. Relax after work and meet some new people.

Because this is a free event where you are not paying a cover or door fee, we humbly request that you please buy one drink or more to support our venue since they are turning away other business to allow us to host our event (buying alcoholic drinks/soft drinks/bottled water helps support the venue -- getting free tap/iced water does not).

First time to one of our events?  See photos from previous happy hours on Meetup or Facebook.

Hope to see you there!

Also find us on Facebook:
https://www.facebook.com/events/442651792607089/
results.name: October 2015 NYAPM Happy Hour

results.description:
Chers ami(e)s,

Thank you for making our now WEEKLY event "Jadore le French" a great success : c’était ma première surprise partie :-) Pictures posted below ! Let's meet again at Cellar Bar to speak French (or at least try a bit with Manhattans).

Special Thanks&HugsⓇ to the new members : you guys rock !Congratulations to Gabor and Abderaman, winners of the last raffle.

MegaHugsⓇ to Amelia, Hostess Etincelante, inventor of a new game using French quotes. 

French is not such a difficult language. If Rocky Balboa can speak Russian, if Rambo can speak Dari, then everybody can speak French, just a question of time :-) The new format "Jadore-le-French" is even nicer than our "Pardon-my-French" of last year.

To facilitate connections and meet&greets, we will have a special fun "lottery" :

Each of you will be given one of my polaroids (http://myinstantfilms.com/). Only TWO PAIRS will be identical. The 4 winners will get an invitation for two at Crepes & Delices, a brand new French crêperie located on 72nd and Columbus. THEY DO HAVE REAL GALETTES DE SARRASIN, AVIS AUX AMATEURS :

http://crepesanddelices.com


Come and get rewards by :

1. Dressing super nicely

2. Showing progress in your French skills (whatever you start from)

None of these are an obligation, neither a demand, just an incentive for rewards (perfumes, hats, free bottles of wine etc.).

Who are the organizers ? Yara, Handsome President, and Jean-Philippe, Glorieux Président. Since 3 weeks, Amelia, aka Superamelia, has joined the team as Hostess Étincelante.

IN THREE YEARS, WE HAVE ORGANIZED HUNDREDS OF SOCIAL EVENTS, FRENCH LESSONS/WORKSHOPS, FRENCH CONCERTS (including launching Flo, now superstar!) etc.

results.description:
Come for the sheer joy of moving to the music, in a nurturing and supportive setting.

Whether you have never danced before or want to continue, this is a class for you.

The classes are one hour and half in length and provide quality instruction.

Ballet is one of the most healthy and intense forms of dance.
It can provide a complete full-body workout, increasing your flexibility, range of motion and strength.

It’s also a great alternative to aerobics.

The classes are on-going, join in anytime.

PRICES Walk-Ins: $20.
Package: $180 for a card of 10 classes (over a course of 6 months).
Talk to us about multiple class per week discount!

ABOUT THE INSTRUCTOR
Bruce Weitzmon is a choreographer, dancer and teacher. His work has been presented in the U.S.A. and Canada. Bruce was the director of the Theater Dance Center, a non-profit dance education and performance organization in Rockland County, founded in 1981. After many years directing TDC, he returned to New York City to teach. Now after more than 10 years there, he is returning to offer a weekly schedule of classes in Nyack, NY.

VISIT US ON FACEBOOK
For more about the Dancers’ Art class schedule, rates or any additional information please visit and like Dancers’ Art on Facebook at www.facebook.com/DancersArt or call[masked]-1973.

results.description:
This may be the friendliest and most social After Work Happy Hour you will experience! Forget about crowded rooftops, long lines to get in and too many people to talk to. 

Whether, you are in business or looking to create a start-up or get funding for one, this is the event for you. This FREE event brings together entrepreneurs, decision-makers and investors to network and build new business relationships in a great venue. You will find many who are open to share information about their business and are willing to build a future business relationship with you!

This way of meeting people is 200 times better than Facebook, Twitter and LinkedIn, both in terms of reaching entrepreneurs and investors, doing so on practically on a ZERO dollar budget. Bring plenty of business cards.

The Lexington Lounge at The Court Hotel in the heart of midtown, you will be able to socialize, network and connect in a fun and friendly atmosphere. 


What: Interesting After Hour Networking Event
Host: Roger
Why: Establish new contacts and/or reconnect with old ones.
Cost: FREE admission
Atmosphere: The dress code is business casual. 

Remember this is a FREE event, there is a one drink suggested minimum, because the venue is turning away other business to allow us to host our event. 


Cocktail Hour till 8 PM - Select Beer 6.00 - House Wine 7.00
   - Well Drinks 8.00 - 25% off Appetizers.

Come alone or bring a friend, either way you will be glad you did. This is a great event for new members to come out and find out what our group is all about plus mix and mingle with long time members and their friends.

THIS IS A MULTI GROUP EVENT. THE RSVP LIST ON THIS PAGE IS ONLY A PORTION OF THOSE ACTUALLY ATTENDING. 

We look forward to see you networking with the best business professionals that New York City has to offer. We ask that you put your name and industry on the name tag that we will provide.

VOLUNTEERING: We will need extra hands. Anyone that would like to assist us with registration, please call or email me. 

SPAM: Please don't spam our members with your products/services or company name/website because your message will be deleted and you will be banned from this group.

Want more business from events? If you are interested in sponsoring our groups or this event, please email me or go to http://businessonashoestring.com/sponsoring.htm 


Comments from past events: 

"For all those who couldn't make it you missed a great night! Lots of great conversation and lovely people to meet Thanks to Roger for his great organisation" - Julia Meyer 

"It was a great meetup, good mix of people and made plenty of new contacts, hope to attend again" - Berni Moestafa 

"Really enjoyed talking to the people I met. Good group. Very open. Welcoming. Will definitely come again!" - Fahd Ansari

"Thank you for hosting the wonderful meet up, I made a lot of new friends over there and I believe people attended are very much enjoy the conversations and the time. I can't wait to be part of the next event!" - Wei Zheng

“One of the most valuable evenings I have experienced in a very long time!” - Rob Friedman 

“Excellent. Diverse and welcoming group of people doing interesting things in the startup world. I look forward to future events” - Amanda

“Great group! Very interesting and diverse start-up biz people, a lot to learn from each other. Very positive experience - looking forward to upcoming events and lectures.” - A D 

“Really enjoyed the personalized yet structured atmosphere the organizers created. I thought this was the most useful meetup I've been to in the past couple months.” - Bill Katz 

"I got a new client, plus I really enjoyed meeting many of you. Thank you!" -Thomas Kant 

This event is organized by Roger Kuperways 
Our family of small business groups have over 7,200 members, inside and outside meetup, and still growing! http://www.businessonashoestring.com

results.description:
This may be the friendliest and most social After Work Happy Hour you will experience! Forget about crowded rooftops, long lines to get in and too many people to talk to. 

Whether, you are in business or looking to create a start-up or get funding for one, this is the event for you. This FREE event brings together entrepreneurs, decision-makers and investors to network and build new business relationships in a great venue. You will find many who are open to share information about their business and are willing to build a future business relationship with you!

This way of meeting people is 200 times better than Facebook, Twitter and LinkedIn, both in terms of reaching entrepreneurs and investors, doing so on practically on a ZERO dollar budget. Bring plenty of business cards.

The Lexington Lounge at The Court Hotel in the heart of midtown, you will be able to socialize, network and connect in a fun and friendly atmosphere. 


What: Interesting After Hour Networking Event
Host: Roger
Why: Establish new contacts and/or reconnect with old ones.
Cost: FREE admission
Atmosphere: The dress code is business casual. 

Remember this is a FREE event, there is a one drink suggested minimum, because the venue is turning away other business to allow us to host our event. 


Cocktail Hour till 8 PM - Select Beer 6.00 - House Wine 7.00
   - Well Drinks 8.00 - 25% off Appetizers.

Come alone or bring a friend, either way you will be glad you did. This is a great event for new members to come out and find out what our group is all about plus mix and mingle with long time members and their friends.

THIS IS A MULTI GROUP EVENT. THE RSVP LIST ON THIS PAGE IS ONLY A PORTION OF THOSE ACTUALLY ATTENDING. 

We look forward to see you networking with the best business professionals that New York City has to offer. We ask that you put your name and industry on the name tag that we will provide.

VOLUNTEERING: We will need extra hands. Anyone that would like to assist us with registration, please call or email me. 

SPAM: Please don't spam our members with your products/services or company name/website because your message will be deleted and you will be banned from this group.

Want more business from events? If you are interested in sponsoring our groups or this event, please email me or go to http://businessonashoestring.com/sponsoring.htm 


Comments from past events: 

"For all those who couldn't make it you missed a great night! Lots of great conversation and lovely people to meet Thanks to Roger for his great organisation" - Julia Meyer 

"It was a great meetup, good mix of people and made plenty of new contacts, hope to attend again" - Berni Moestafa 

"Really enjoyed talking to the people I met. Good group. Very open. Welcoming. Will definitely come again!" - Fahd Ansari

"Thank you for hosting the wonderful meet up, I made a lot of new friends over there and I believe people attended are very much enjoy the conversations and the time. I can't wait to be part of the next event!" - Wei Zheng

“One of the most valuable evenings I have experienced in a very long time!” - Rob Friedman 

“Excellent. Diverse and welcoming group of people doing interesting things in the startup world. I look forward to future events” - Amanda

“Great group! Very interesting and diverse start-up biz people, a lot to learn from each other. Very positive experience - looking forward to upcoming events and lectures.” - A D 

“Really enjoyed the personalized yet structured atmosphere the organizers created. I thought this was the most useful meetup I've been to in the past couple months.” - Bill Katz 

"I got a new client, plus I really enjoyed meeting many of you. Thank you!" -Thomas Kant 

This event is organized by Roger Kuperways 
Our family of small business groups have over 7,200 members, inside and outside meetup, and still growing! http://www.businessonashoestring.com

results.description:
Dear friends,

Thank you for making our weekly Social Monday's a great success.

Pictures posted below ! Let's meet again at Cellar Bar to socialize, and make new friends.

Special Thanks&HugsⓇ to the new members: you guys rock!Congratulations to Gabor and Abderaman, winners of the last raffle.

MegaHugsⓇ to Amelia, Hostess Etincelante, inventor of a new game using French quotes.

Come and get rewards by: 

1. Dressing super nicely

2. Playing our games

None of which are an obligation, neither a demand, just an incentive for rewards (perfumes, hats, free bottles of wine etc.).

Who are the organizers? Yara, Handsome President, and Jean-Philippe, Glorieux Président. Since 3 weeks, Amelia, aka Superamelia, has joined the team as Hostess Étincelante.

IN THREE YEARS, WE HAVE ORGANIZED HUNDREDS OF SOCIAL EVENTS, FRENCH MONDAY'S/SOCIAL MONDAY'S/ (including launching Flo, now superstar!) etc.

Pics from last events

-- Jean-Philippe, Yara, Amelia

results.description:
Chers ami(e)s,

Thank you for making our now WEEKLY event "Jadore le French" a great success : c’était ma première surprise partie :-) Pictures posted below ! Let's meet again at Cellar Bar to speak French (or at least try a bit with Manhattans).

Special Thanks&HugsⓇ to the new members : you guys rock !Congratulations to Gabor and Abderaman, winners of the last raffle.

MegaHugsⓇ to Amelia, Hostess Etincelante, inventor of a new game using French quotes. 

French is not such a difficult language. If Rocky Balboa can speak Russian, if Rambo can speak Dari, then everybody can speak French, just a question of time :-) The new format "Jadore-le-French" is even nicer than our "Pardon-my-French" of last year.

To facilitate connections and meet&greets, we will have a special fun "lottery" :

Each of you will be given one of my polaroids (http://myinstantfilms.com/). Only TWO PAIRS will be identical. The 4 winners will get an invitation for two at Crepes & Delices, a brand new French crêperie located on 72nd and Columbus. THEY DO HAVE REAL GALETTES DE SARRASIN, AVIS AUX AMATEURS :

http://crepesanddelices.com


Come and get rewards by :

1. Dressing super nicely

2. Showing progress in your French skills (whatever you start from)

None of these are an obligation, neither a demand, just an incentive for rewards (perfumes, hats, free bottles of wine etc.).

Who are the organizers ? Yara, Handsome President, and Jean-Philippe, Glorieux Président. Since 3 weeks, Amelia, aka Superamelia, has joined the team as Hostess Étincelante.

IN THREE YEARS, WE HAVE ORGANIZED HUNDREDS OF SOCIAL EVENTS, FRENCH LESSONS/WORKSHOPS, FRENCH CONCERTS (including launching Flo, now superstar!) etc.

Pics from last Jadore le French :

Merci beaucoup et à lundi prochain !

-- Jean-Philippe, Yara, Amelia

results.name: French Monday's @ Cellar Bar

results.description:
These days, technological innovation moves at a breakneck pace. Due in part to advances in rapid prototyping, developments in 3D printing, and the integration of the Internet of Things, entrepreneurs can test and iterate a product to bring it to market with relatively few resources. This panel discussion brings together a technologist, an artist, and an expert in the business of 3D printing to discuss how these rapid prototyping technologies are affecting their industries and how they envision prototyping evolving in the future.

ABOUT THE PANELISTS:


DUANN SCOTT

Duann  is a designer, researcher and writer specializing in understanding and communicating complex ideas in a succinct, easy to understand manner, to both educate and inspire.  Described by The New York Times as the “Pied Piper for on demand 3D Printing,” he has been recognized for his role in bringing 3D printing out of the back rooms of engineering firms, and into mass consciousness. He has worked with major brands, artists, designers and institutions, as well as high school students and seven year olds, to incorporate 3D printing into their lives in a meaningful way.


SCOTT BEIBIN

Scott is a self-taught engineer, artist and performer. He's the co-designer of many of the liberation technologies used in The Groucho Fractal Show, a touring live performance focusing on the intersection of science, consciousness and environmental sustainability. He's one of the co-designers of TheMandelBot: Function Is The Key, a RepRap inspired 3D Printer built largely from post-consumer and biodegradable re-purposed materials. His day job is as chief strategist at the Evil Twin Booking Agency / The Redefinery of which he is a co-founder. He can hula hoop and play accordion at the same time.


ANDREW IPPOLITI 

Andrew is an Electrical Engineer working for BotFactory. He has spent the last 2 years creating a machine that can print and assemble electronic circuits on a desktop. His work includes creating an optical correction system for pick and place as well as coding the algorithms that convert design files to the final output. When not improving the printer's software he plays with 3d printing and prototyping electronics.


EREK TINKER

Erek is the Director of Business Development for The Spry Group and has been moderating the Future of Series for Pax Solaria. He is interested in the technical, business and cultural implications of new technologies. He loves bringing together diverse views on interesting topics to stimulate engaging conversations.
results.name: Future of Rapid Prototyping (Panel Discussion)

results.description:
BVault is a massive, scalable, archiving and e-discovery solution for communications and has been adopted by more than 800 enterprises, processing more than 220 million daily messages with an archive containing more than 90 billion communication objects. The service is optimized for fast deployment of data-centric and processing-intensive applications using elastic cloud computing strategies. We use Apache Mesos to abstract heterogeneous data center assets as a homogeneous set of resources, prefabricated hardware in secure and geographically distributed data centers to provide on-demand capacity management, and Continuous development and integration using containers as an emerging standard in cloud infrastructure.


We share the lessons learned along the way, and tools we needed to build that enable us to validate, monitor, and operate the platform in production.


Approximate time: 30 mins + Q/A


Linkedin: https://www.linkedin.com/in/skand

Twitter: @skandsg
results.name: Mesos @ Bloomberg

results.description:
This may be the friendliest and most social After Work Happy Hour you will experience! Forget about crowded rooftops, long lines to get in and too many people to talk to. 

Whether, you are in business or looking to create a start-up or get funding for one, this is the event for you. This FREE event brings together entrepreneurs, decision-makers and investors to network and build new business relationships in a great venue. You will find many who are open to share information about their business and are willing to build a future business relationship with you!

This way of meeting people is 200 times better than Facebook, Twitter and LinkedIn, both in terms of reaching entrepreneurs and investors, doing so on practically on a ZERO dollar budget. Bring plenty of business cards.

The Lexington Lounge at The Court Hotel in the heart of midtown, you will be able to socialize, network and connect in a fun and friendly atmosphere. 

What: Interesting After Hour Networking Event
Host: Roger
Why: Establish new contacts and/or reconnect with old ones.
Cost: FREE admission
Atmosphere: The dress code is business casual. 

Remember this is a FREE event, there is a one drink suggested minimum, because the venue is turning away other business to allow us to host our event. 


Cocktail Hour till 8 PM - Select Beer 6.00 - House Wine 7.00
   - Well Drinks 8.00 - 25% off Appetizers.


Come alone or bring a friend, either way you will be glad you did. This is a great event for new members to come out and find out what our group is all about plus mix and mingle with long time members and their friends.

THIS IS A MULTI GROUP EVENT. THE RSVP LIST ON THIS PAGE IS ONLY A PORTION OF THOSE ACTUALLY ATTENDING. 

We look forward to see you networking with the best business professionals that New York City has to offer. 

We ask that you put your name and industry on the name tag that we will provide.

VOLUNTEERING: We will need extra hands. Anyone that would like to assist us with registration, please call or email me. 

SPAM: Please don't spam our members with your products/services or company name/website because your message will be deleted and you will be banned from this group.

Want more business from events? If you are interested in sponsoring our groups or this event, please email me or go to http://businessonashoestring.com/sponsoring.htm 


Comments from past events: 

"For all those who couldn't make it you missed a great night! Lots of great conversation and lovely people to meet Thanks to Roger for his great organisation" - Julia Meyer 

"It was a great meetup, good mix of people and made plenty of new contacts, hope to attend again" - Berni Moestafa 

"Really enjoyed talking to the people I met. Good group. Very open. Welcoming. Will definitely come again!" - Fahd Ansari

"Thank you for hosting the wonderful meet up, I made a lot of new friends over there and I believe people attended are very much enjoy the conversations and the time. I can't wait to be part of the next event!" - Wei Zheng

“One of the most valuable evenings I have experienced in a very long time!” - Rob Friedman 

“Excellent. Diverse and welcoming group of people doing interesting things in the startup world. I look forward to future events” - Amanda

“Great group! Very interesting and diverse start-up biz people, a lot to learn from each other. Very positive experience - looking forward to upcoming events and lectures.” - A D 

“Really enjoyed the personalized yet structured atmosphere the organizers created. I thought this was the most useful meetup I've been to in the past couple months.” - Bill Katz 

"I got a new client, plus I really enjoyed meeting many of you. Thank you!" -Thomas Kant 

This event is organized by Roger Kuperways 
Our family of small business groups have over 7,200 members, inside and outside meetup, and still growing! http://www.businessonashoestring.com

results.description:
**There are 100 people signed up for the league who are there every night REGARDLESS of who is signed up from Meetup - so don't worry about how many people have RSVP'ed just here on Meetup.  We just leave up the Meetup for any new people (that's you!) who would want to come join us.  There are ALWAYS a ton of people.**
www.sandlotsportsnyc.com/open-gym

Who: Exactly 1 buttload of good people
What: Dodgeball!
Where: Manhattan, West Village, St Luke School, 487 Hudson St
When: Monday, 7pm
Why: Fun n stuff
How: read below...

Oh hi there person reading this.  My name's Ari.  You should come play dodgeball with us.  That's a fun game.  Remember that from grade school?  Yeah, apparently when you're an adult you're still allowed to do that.  Who knew?  Oh, and now we get to go to a bar afterward instead of back to math class.  So there's that.  Adulthood has its perks.

See, here's some photos of shenanigans:

Doesn't that look like good times?  And good times are the best kinds of times.

---

So we are the only rubber dodgeball league in the city.  And we're also the only sports league that lets people come play every week just to drop in and check it out and play without joining the league.  And hey!  That could be you.  You're a people right?  Excellent.

We're in the middle of our summer season right now, which means there are 90 people there every single night who are on an official team and all. All of whom you can/should come play with and/or drink beers with.

Don't worry, we don't bite.  We WANT new people to come show up.  That's how we get more people involved in this ridiculously awesome silly game.

We don't just throw you to wolves - we'll introduce you around, explain everything, and no experience or athleticism necessary! No one's gonna bully you or not want to play/hang out with you for being "bad" - no one cares about that...that's what a dick would do.  And we're not dicks.

So every night, during the season before official league games is just open gym to come play laid back pickup games with the rest of us - running around, and getting sweaty .  And then you can come to the bar with us and share in all of our league discounts and drink specials and parties and all.

Good times eh?  Then maybe next season you'd want to join us for realsies on a team and all.  Or not.  But know we'll cry if you don't.  And then you'll have that on your conscience.  Either way, free to come try it out.  So unless you're a goober, you should probably come check it out, right?  You wouldn't want to be a goober would you?  Would you!?

Any questions, don't hesitate!  We'll get back to you!  [masked]

Just RSVP at www.sandlotsportsnyc.com/open-gym

facebook.com/sandlotsportsnyc

www.sandlotsportsnyc.com

A firm embrace,
Ari

<a href="http://www.sandlotsportsnyc.com"></a>

results.description:
As seen in the CNBC Documentary The Bitcoin Uprising. 

Enter “The Nakamoto Circle of All Satoshi Squares” aka the World’s Largest Direct Sellers-to-Buyers Bitcoin Trading Pit! 

Starting at 6:00 p.m. Bitcoin Center NYC welcomes Satoshi Square for a night of spontaneous Bitcoin trading in a LIVE open outcry trading pit. Buy or sell Bitcoins with Satoshi Square and others, or just observe and enjoy a party among fellow Bitcoin enthusiasts. Open bar!

This event is perfect for expert and novice traders as well as exhibitors, vendors, hardware and software developers, educators, students, media, and anyone wanting to be acquainted with the technology. Talk to our experts and get feedback concerning Bitcoin-related startups, as we are an incubator for these. Gaze upon MiningBot and Cash2BTC, two examples of path-breaking Bitcoin hardware the center co-developed. Meet or become a center sponsor and get exposure among the right audience and media!

No matter the focus of your Bitcoin interest or your expertise level, you are welcome. Bring a friend who might have read or heard something about Bitcoin. With our assistance he or she will leave with a better understanding and their first electronic or paper wallet. 

All trading is organic, spontaneous, and occurs directly between sellers and buyers. There are no intermediaries, and no fees as we are neither a trading floor nor a brokerage. Drinks and hospitality are courtesy of Bitcoin Center NYC. 

Details follow. See you there!

Every Monday & Thursday Night

6:00 p.m. to 11:00 p.m.

results.description:
If you have Facebook RSVP HERE.

Does the concept of a technical interview sound awful? Want to gain some insight into what the technical hiring process is like? Join Dev Bootcamp for this technical interview preparation workshop.

We’ll start out with an overview of the process, but will focus on hands-on practice of the skills you’ll need. Many interview processes for hiring developers include whiteboarding, in which you’ll be asked to solve algorithms on a whiteboard, explaining your thinking process along the way.

In this workshop, you’ll practice whiteboarding in small groups, split up based on language. Beginners will have their own group learning basics - everyone is welcome! The curriculum will be shared with attendees after the event. 

As usual we'll have pizza and drinks for everyone :)

Please keep in mind our anti-harassment policy: http://techatnyu.org/anti-harassment
results.name: Prepping for the Technical Interview

results.description:
These days, technological innovation moves at a breakneck pace. Due in part to advances in rapid prototyping, developments in 3D printing, and the integration of the Internet of Things, entrepreneurs can test and iterate a product to bring it to market with relatively few resources. This panel discussion brings together a technologist, an artist, and an expert in the business of 3D printing to discuss how these rapid prototyping technologies are affecting their industries and how they envision prototyping evolving in the future.

ABOUT THE PANELISTS:
DUANN SCOTT is a designer, researcher and writer specializing in understanding and communicating complex ideas in a succinct, easy to understand manner, to both educate and inspire.  Described by The New York Times as the “Pied Piper for on demand 3D Printing,” he has been recognized for his role in bringing 3D printing out of the back rooms of engineering firms, and into mass consciousness. He has worked with major brands, artists, designers and institutions, as well as high school students and seven year olds, to incorporate 3D printing into their lives in a meaningful way.


SCOTT BEIBIN is a self-taught engineer, artist and performer. He's the co-designer of many of the liberation technologies used in The Groucho Fractal Show, a touring live performance focusing on the intersection of science, consciousness and environmental sustainability. He's one of the co-designers of TheMandelBot: Function Is The Key, a RepRap inspired 3D Printer built largely from post-consumer and biodegradable re-purposed materials. His day job is as chief strategist at the Evil Twin Booking Agency / The Redefinery of which he is a co-founder. He can hula hoop and play accordion at the same time.


ANDREW IPPOLITI is an Electrical Engineer working for BotFactory. He has spent the last 2 years creating a machine that can print and assemble electronic circuits on a desktop. His work includes creating an optical correction system for pick and place as well as coding the algorithms that convert design files to the final output. When not improving the printer's software he plays with 3d printing and prototyping electronics.


EREK TINKER is the Director of Business Development for The Spry Group and has been moderating the Future of Series for Pax Solaria. He is interested in the technical, business and cultural implications of new technologies. He loves bringing together diverse views on interesting topics to stimulate engaging conversations.
results.name: The Future of Rapid Prototyping (Panel Discussion)

This is an event focused more on the networking side of things, so if you have a business, looking for a career change, or have a special skill set you would like to share, bring your business cards with you and let's network!

****Please see below for more info from Serafina! :

For 20 years, Serafina has spread its love for delicious Italian flavors across the world from Mumbai to Boston. Now, we’ve come home to where it all started – New York City. The opening of Serafina Harlem is the eighth in the five boroughs and we can’t wait to meet our new neighbors!

We have proudly perfected authentic, original recipes in each of our pizza, pasta and seafood dishes. Please, join us for lunch, dinner or drinks anytime! Welcome home to Serafina Harlem!

results.description:
Our small, yet intrepid band of heroes returns to Everlund, staggeringly powerful, evil, magical artifact in tow. Their intent is to do as they were instructed and deliver the artifact to the grubby hands of the one who hired / coerced them to retrieve it in the first place.

But their travel plans are interrupted. They meet a rather troublesome elf named Danis and agree to travel with him. But this alliance lasts less than a full day and night when Danis attempts to pilfer the mage's spellbook. He's exiled from the group...so to speak.

The bigger problem they have is an overwhelming fog that has clouded their journey. When it finally lifts, they learn they're not in Elysia anymore. And that's when the werewolves come.

results.description:
Hey Meeples!  Since this is the Monday before Halloween, tonight's meetup will be all horror themed, so bring your zombie, Cthulhu and other horror themed games for some frightening gaming!!

Our weekly Meet Up will take place at Scotty's Steakhouse and Comedy Cove in Springfield, just a bit off of exit 9B on Route 24! The address is 595 Morris Ave, Springfield.


There is a world of gaming outside of the traditional Monopoly/Scrabble/Risk/etc. Be adventurous and come learn some new games that will change the way you think about board games!

We begin gathering around 6pm and are fully underway by 7pm.

Because the event takes place at a restaurant that serves alcohol, there are strict rules against gambling of any form.  Guests under 21 are welcome, as it is a restaurant. Since they are letting us use the space for free, they expect that we will order food and drink, so there are some rules:

1.  No outside food or drink, not even bottled water.

2. Please plan on ordering food and/or drinks.  Support the venue.

3. Tip the waitstaff generously.  15% is standard, but 20% is even better. We want them to love having us there, and in this case, money does buy you love.


We bring some of our games, but feel free to bring your favorites, or learn one of ours! And don't be shy about learning new games, we are more than willing to teach a new player! Can't wait to see you there.

results.description:
At times, finding or maintaining a positive self-image can be difficult. We are living in a unique time where dwindling confidence can be the result of social media, unrealistic expectations, life's hardships and more. Or perhaps you never quite found that confidence you've been searching for.

Self-esteem also has a direct relationship to our individual happiness. Improving your self-image can benefit you outwardly in your career, relationships and more; as well as allowing you to feel better and happier overall.

Please join me for some coffee & coaching where we will work on a different piece of the self-esteem puzzle each week, in addition to supporting you as you work through your specific roadblock(s). Whether you can attend one meeting or the whole series, I'm certain you will benefit from the work we do together!

results.description:
Welcome to our monthly Veg Night Out! This month it's at Ph-D of Dream Downtown Hotel located in Chelsea by Meatpacking, 16th & 9th Ave.  ("Ph-D" stands for "Penthouse Dream", and the venue name is completely accurate: this luxe lounge is a dream of a penthouse.) It will be a perfect location for us to chill and enjoy the evening.

New York Magazine: “Decked out in mirrors, black marble, and strobe-lit prism glass chandeliers, PH-D is the Dream Downtown's throwback to an 80's penthouse… Twelve stories up, the real draw is the long narrow deck that spans the left side of the space with banquettes--some intimate for no more than three, some larger for up to twelve--overgrown plants, and one of the city's most spectacular views, facing north with clear shots of the Empire State Building and City skyscape…”


From 6:30pm-9:30pm 


Ph-D (Penthouse bar)

Dream Downtown Hotel

355 W 16th St, New York, NY 10011

(212)[masked]

The Financial Times considers PH-D of Dream Downtown Hotel one of New York’s the best rooftop bars.: “…Dream Downtown is going to be a game-changer for the city’s hotel scene, and the roof-top bar PH-D (it stands for penthouse dream) is a significant part of that. It is in the best location – on 16th Street and 9th Avenue…”


From NYC Tips (www.nyctips.com): “One of the coolest bars …The place has an amazing decor, super modern, with glass windows and an outdoor space... also offers a view from the city that takes the breath away… If the goal is to experience the nightlife in NY, the PH-D can not be left out of your list.”


Per NYTimes: “…PH-D is a fine-cut diamond of glass and polished surfaces. Triple-tiered chandeliers with hundreds of glass rods hang above marble tables...Midtown twinkles in the expansive view…" 


Cititours.com says: “Hardly any venues in New York encompass a fabulous spot with a priceless view. PH-D has both and more…"


Zagat gives a 25 for atmosphere and 25 for décor: “Crowning Chelsea's Dream Downtown Hotel, this 'sleek and sexy' lounge is an education in the 'elite club scene' as 'rich men and the leggy girls they want to impress' get 'reckless with their credit cards' in chandeliered quarters equipped with an expansive terrace featuring 'killer' Midtown views; no surprise, it's also 'hard to get in.'" 


With all the wonderful vegetarians and vegans who attend each of our events, every event we do is liked by our members, but our "Veg Night Out!" events are the most popular of all.  People enjoy the fact they can mingle (speak with lots of different people), and they love the beautiful venues that we go to. Join us for a stellar evening of lively conversation and lovely surroundings with fellow vegetarians and vegans.  

For our new members: this is an incredibly friendly and welcoming group. We'll be hanging out by the main bar area, and you can get to know all our wonderful members.

This event has no cover and no minimum. But please do buy a drink or two, or as many as you like. There is a full selection of non-alcoholic beverages available if you prefer not to drink alcohol. The venue requests that you dress appropriately: business, business casual or smart casual.

Where to meet: We will by the main bar area when you walk in. 

Join us for an elegant, fun and relaxed night of socializing with fellow vegetarians and vegans.

Eddie
results.how_to_find_us: How to find us: We will meet at the main bar when you walk in. Look for the group of friendly veg'ns.
results.name: Veg Night Out! Drinks at the Dream Hotel Downtown - Indoor Rooftop Lounge

Events are intended for people who identify as women, which includes trans women. Our Code of Conduct applies to all events run by Women Who Code, Inc.


So what exactly IS this group? This is a weekly group of intermediates and advanced participants. We meet every Monday and provide you with the space to continue your project or ideas of projects you can work on with other attendees over a period of several weeks and help for when you get stuck.

Who is this event for? This event is for intermediates (members looking to start building a project or learn a framework) and advanced members (industry women looking for other fabulous engineers!), but beginners are welcome to attend as well. 

If you are an intermediate or advanced member and would like either demo a project or try teaching, please reach out to [masked]!

Materials? Please bring a laptop and either a Front-End enthusiast or newbie!

7:00 Welcome from Women Who Code 
7:05 Welcome from our host and demos 
7:20 Meetup starts 
9:00/9:30 Meetup ends

A valid photo ID will be required to enter the building. Please be sure to enter your full name when RSVPing for this event.

results.description:
Taking our cue from our Freethought Day speaker (See Meetup Oct 11) in our second meeting of the “semester”, we’ll consider the relationship between the philosophy of Stoicism, ancient and modern, and humanism.

Professor Pigliucci recommends our book as an introduction to the philosophy and a guide to its practice. The online Internet Encyclopedia of Philosophy article is short and comprehensible to us laypeople. As a bonus, we’ll post a video of Massimo’s Freethought Day talk as soon as we can after Oct 11. 

Our reading for Oct 26 is: 

Book: Irvine, William B.: A Guide to the Good Life: The Ancient Art of Stoic Joy.

Online: Stoicism at http://www.iep.utm.edu/stoicism

Video: Check www.shsny.org after 10/15 for Massimo’s talk.

Note: Studying Humanism is a study group. If you have not done the reading, you may audit the discussion. ALL are welcome, definitely including newcomers!
results.name: Studying Humanism: STOICISM & HUMANISM

Implementing a practical REST-based API can be a challenge. In this course, Shawn will show us how to take his design course and implement it in ASP.NET Web API including controllers, routing, dependency injection, versioning, security, hypermedia, REST constraints and caching.

To join us at this course it will be assumed that you have already watched Shawn's course on how to design a RESTful API (http://pluralsight.com/courses/web-api-design).  This course covered how to design a RESTful API while avoiding the dogmatic religion of REST but embracing the best of the pragmatic parts.

results.description:
Join us for an enlightening discussion about breaking in, finding your way, and creating your community within the tech industry. The panel will include perspectives from the developer, entrepreneur, corporate and community LGBT voices. 

Agenda
6:30pm Arrive and Network
7:00pm Panel Discussion with Audience Q&A
8:00pm Speed Networking


About Our Panelists:

Lauren Gallinaro
Full Stack Developer
@_Gallinaro

Lauren is a developer passionate about building things that are beautiful and highly usable. Having graduated from Parsons where she studied Industrial Design, her professional interests live at the intersection of design and technology. She has worked on projects ranging from 3D printing with unconventional materials, to developing algorithms that generate form, and developing well crafted software that challenges good design as a luxury. As a graduate of Dev Bootcamp, she hopes to show people that programming can be creative, and encourage more designers to pursue any spark of interest in software development.  When she is not trying to learn a new language or framework, her favorite activities include spilling coffee on white shirts, and not putting enough salt in her cooking.


Corrine Phillips
Application Developer, JP Morgan Chase
@corinnephillips

Corinne Phillips is a full stack applications developer working in the Corporate Technology Risk division of JP Morgan Chase. During her tenure, she has been tasked with updating and improving legacy systems in order to provide superior user experience and preferential applications. She specializes in development using CEAN Stack (Cassandra, Express, AngularJS, NodeJS) with SOLR integration as well as .NET web API development.


Justin Scier 
Founder & CEO, Livecube 
@justinschier 


JUSTIN SCHIER is a hybrid designer and developer with over 15 years of direct experience in the Engagement space. He has been a business owner since 1999, the lead developer on large projects for companies such as JD Power and Associates, Bentley Motorcars, USC, and at least 100 others. He leads the design and development efforts on livecube, an innovative web app for events that uniquely fuses game mechanics and social media. He lives in New York City and blogs at Ghost Transmission (ghosttx.com).


Big Thanks To Our Sponsor! 


About Dev Bootcamp
@devbootcamp 

Dev Bootcamp is the original short-term, immersive software development program that transforms those new to coding into job-ready, full-stack web developers in a rigorous and supportive environment. As a company we are committed to fostering an inclusive environment that respects and values the contributions from students of all backgrounds and actively supports a diverse tech culture.

results.description:
https://lh6.googleusercontent.com/zjvNKqgQdFlADA5WNQwQLle8iofV9HZGFdI3NyYRCskb1YAP23p4T8Vk2rNuWktDuWE00vOnev3QfOUzrno2IGnYTkAEdBKptRO4hSV5p2jXT890T-yNZ-gj_AMATYRw6RcDPJtx

Join Be Social Change on Monday, October 26th from 6:30 to 9:30 PM for Unlock Your Network - Access the Power of the Resources You Already Have w/ The Opportunity Lab's Mark Monchek & Jaki Bradley. 

We all exist in networks full of unseen opportunities. Resource Mapping is designed to help us identify those opportunities and realize that no matter what goal we are trying to accomplish, we have the necessary resources to accomplish them RIGHT NOW. With Resource Mapping, you can visualize your resources as an ECOSYSTEM – a changing and living network – and use that ecosystem to accomplish your most important goals. In this workshop, we will teach you how to build a resource map as well as discuss the principles of maintaining and using such a map effectively. You’ll walk away knowing that you have far more resources at your disposal than you realize.   

===========================================

This is a paid class. Be sure to purchase your ticket here: http://bit.ly/BSCNetworkOct26

===========================================

 * Doors open at 6:15, class starts at 6:30 sharp *

WHAT YOU'LL LEARN

How to maintain a mindset of opportunityHow to leverage the power of your resource ecosystemHow to use a resource map to accomplish a specific goal 


 WHO THIS CLASS IS FOR

All professionalsBusiness leaders from any sectorFounders or employees of startup or seasoned social enterprisesFounders or employees of startup or seasoned nonprofitsStudents - undergraduate or graduate


 INSTRUCTOR BIOS

After 25 years of growing entrepreneurial businesses and nonprofits, Mark Monchek’s (@MarkMonchek) mission is to help entrepreneurs build profitable and meaningful businesses in ways that make the world a better place. As president of The Opportunity Lab, Mark leverages his expertise in executive coaching and consulting to create programs that spark innovation, growth, and acceleration in the social enterprise space. His innovative approach has benefited companies such as Apple, General Electric, The New York Times, The Wharton School of Business, the Harvard Business School Club, Cornell University, YPO, and NBC. He is a passionate storyteller and facilitator of meaningful dialog, and his goal for this workshop is to change participants’ belief about what is possible for their future.

You can learn about Mark’s current work here and find out more about his background here.

Bobbi Van sees her life as a work of art.  For her every day is a new adventure filled with possibility in seeing the beauty in the simple and easily overlooked. As an entrepreneur, producer and fundraiser Bobbi worked with the Museum of Natural History and Universal Pictures to create an educational program based on Jurassaic Park that reached 8 million kids to inspire and educate; an educational program in South Africa under the auspicious of the ANC, a branding project with the Pearl, a major real estate complex in Qatar and many philanthropic projects.  As a mentor she worked with five executive women to help 6 young girls reach college after years in foster homes.  Bobbi also has also mentored young people who have been abused by helping them tell their stories through art.  

In 2002, Bobbi began her career as an artist and a sculptor. Her work drew the attention of many collectors and her work has shown in Lincoln Center, Regionale Museo in Moralia, Mexico, Guild Hall in East Hampton, the Navila Group and the Asia Contemporary Art Fair in Hong Kong.  In May, 2015 she will show her work at debut of the FLUX ART FAIR in Harlem.  Since 2009 Bobbi has been a member TEDx New York Salon community as a facilitator/curator and member of the organizing team.    

SPACE PARTNER  

https://lh6.googleusercontent.com/KPL4uynCqIoMu2deyfpUIP59J1-rk9uZwr8AQMeHBdGbJTw9YsL_JSkKxTZucHnuclxQsW120aO4HFk4uK8rilV2ZxPHbeyg-sLyxfzjQdMmcjLV-29EequKqpboQGQlLg


The Centre for Social Innovation (@csiSL) is a home for nonprofits and social entrepreneurs in New York City. They’re building a movement of passionate people committed to a better world. Learn more at http://nyc.socialinnovation.org/
results.name: BSC Class: Unlock Your Network - Access the Power of Resources You Already Have
