results.description:
Join our Christmas Blues Rock Ensemble in time to perform a great Holiday show in December!
We’ll be playing Christmas classics “Merry Christmas, Baby”, “Please come home for Christmas”, “JIngle Bell Rock” and more!
We’ll have 10 practices and then perform on Sunday, December 13th at Arlene’s Grocery at 3pm. SHOW

The show will be at Arlene's Grocery in the East Village December 13th at 1pm(soundcheck) and doors at 2pm. Our show will be at 3pm. Arlene's is an awesome show venue with professional stage, sound and lights, everyone will be miked or amplified. If you are coming to rehearsal with a portable amp you should also bring it to the venue.

We will have a drummer and a singer TBA.

There will be tickets for this show, they can be purchase before hand (starting in November) at $5 or at the door for $10.

There is a show fee of $30 for each ensemble member that will go toward venue, sound engineer and hired musicians costs.

Arlene's Grocery is strictly 21+ and no children will be allowed at the show even if they are accompanied by the parent, I'm sorry:( :(

There are two bars on site and lots of food spots and great restaurants in the area for before or after the show.

CALENDAR

Our practice schedule starts Thursday 6-8pm on October 1st.

It is important that you attend to as many as you can if you plan on performing, a required 7 session minimum will be necessary to perform and VERY IMPORTANT that you come to the last 2 practices which will be with a drummer and a singer
results.how_to_find_us: between 7th and 8th Ave
results.name: Join our Christmas Blues Rock ensemble!

results.description:
Real Self Defense is Offensive in nature. 

KravMaguy offers a true, authentic Israeli Defense Forces (IDF) training experience emphasizing hand-to-hand combat, tactical and warrior training for both men and women. The Head instructor was featured in the History Channel – The Human Weapon- a documentary about Krav Maga in Israel. His last assignment was as Tactical Security Team Leader working off the coast of East Africa. 

In this basics class you will learn to defend yourself and survive knife wielding assassins, sexual assaults or any would be attacker looking to take your life using the basic principles of kravmaguy level one system. In the end only your are responsible for your own protection. You cannot rely on others when split seconds count.

Topics covered in Level One 8 week course:
Jab cross 
Fighting Stance
Weak body spots
Hook uppercut
Basic footwork
Punching jab cross
Elbows regular
Knees
Groin strikes- knees, shin to groin, groin jab (lead leg)
Knife hands
Escape- RNC
Escape guillotine
Escape schoolyard headlock (requires matted area)
Physical requirements to pass level one:
20 pushups
35 sit ups
30 squats
Level 2 training prep


check out this youtube video to see kravmaguy knife defense in action, these techniques are used by murderers and terrorists to kill countless innocents and knowing these basic defenses can save your life and the ones you love

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=BbzLjAUlyzU

the eye rake to elbow to the spine: a kravmaguy classic:
results.how_to_find_us: Price per class is $25.00. New students first class is $12.00, RSVP's encouraged.  Tell the receptionist you are here for Krav Maga and turn right to the Martial Arts room- can't miss us.
results.name: Krav Maga Level One

group.name: Krav Maga Basics, Rape Defense- NYC Midtown (Kravmaguy)

results.description:
• Description :Let's meet and have a great time dancing in One of NYC's Top Dance Parties as featured in Timeout New York Magazine, celebrating their 6th year @ Taj Lounge!
Great dinner and dancing experience, live music, performers and guest DJ's. 

• RSVP: To enjoy the reduced admission , Mention the code that you will see in the comment section, it is different every week !!

• Price: $10 if you RSVP on the meet up. 

• Time:  8 pm- 2am ( Salsa Lesson at 7.00pm)


• Address: Taj Lounge, 48 W 21st St, New York

• What to wear: Dancing is about movement and enjoyment. We recommend wearing comfortable clothing that allows you to be flexible and relaxed. In order to be able to move comfortably across the floor, we advise that you do not wear rubber-soled shoes.

• Do I need a partner ?: No, you don’t need to bring a partner. We rotate during the group class, It will give you the opportunity to dance and meet different people.
results.name: Salsa dancing with Salsa New York @ Taj Lounge: Live Music + Performances

results.description:
This will be the official Korean beginner's class. The class material will be provided. We will go through all the basics and foundations, and practice with fun activities.

If you know how to read Korean letters(Hangul) you can join the class. If you haven't learned at all but would like to join the class, please email me.

Since I need to book a space ahead, please consider your RSVP seriously and let me know if you can't make it after you said YES to come.

The location will be either near Bryant park or Korea town. The exact location will be sent to members privately. Please, email me at [masked] with your contact number if you can come. I will send mine so we can communicate better when the meet up happens.

The class fee will be $15 per person. Once you commit for 4 weeks series of classes it will be $40. Please, note you won't get a credit if you cancel your attendance on the same day. Be prepared for the class! :)

We may hang out and mingle after the class. I'm very excited to see you all and look forward to it! 
If you have any questions,please leave a comment.
results.how_to_find_us: Email me at MyKoreanLessonTutor@gmail.com
results.name: Korean beginner Plus

results.description:
TurnOn - yourself, your relationships, your sex. This is the place to excavate what you truly desire. Have you wondered how to create the relationships you want? Experience the intimacy you crave? Where you can say the honest truth to your partner, your family, your lover and yet stay grounded in yourself?

We believe that no matter what type of relationship you desire, human connection is at the basis of genuine relating. We play a set of intimate communication games that let you sharpen your relating skills and hone your attention. You get to shed off the layers that keep us from being seen, be vulnerable and feel more alive. We play 3 games (you can play at whatever level feels comfortable to you). It's a refreshing change from the typical “Hi, how are you?” conversation. You get the opportunity to examine yourself. Through other people putting quality attention on you, asking questions with genuine curiosity, and then listening - really listening – to your responses.

What comes up might surprise you!

It's amazing how connected we can end up feeling - even in a room full of strangers - when we are willing to say what's real. At the end of the evening we will tell you all about how you can learn the practice of Orgasmic Meditation. What class you can take and what we have to offer so you can work towards having the intimacy you want.

Come early, doors close at 8:10p. COST TO ATTEND IS $10.

For questions contact [masked] |[masked]

Can't make this one? Visit us at www.turnonny.us

results.description:
Take a a chance and learn something new. Come to our Argentine Tango for Beginners classes and see what all the passionate fuss is all about.  If you learn the right way from the start, you will not develop any bad habits.  Mayte will take you through the concepts, steps and techniques able to get you moving quickly on the dance floor so you can start being a part of the beautiful social dance scene in New York City, Westchester and surrounding areas. 

Come enjoy the pleasure of live music, great performances, wonderful friends and the joy of moving to the music in a warm embrace. If you've already learned other dances, come and improve your sense of balance, elegance, leading and following while taking on this Argentine wonder and discovering a new way to move and express yourself.

We'll look forward to seeing you there.
results.name: Argentine Tango for Beginners

OneTaste NYC is an organization teaches Orgasmic Meditation, otherwise known as OM. The games we play at TurnON are designed to create the visceral sensation of Orgasm/OM in your body, without having to actually do the practice (or remove any clothing!).

It's a friendly invitation to play and push your edges in a way that feels good. This allows you to stretch yourself and inspires self-discovery!

Come early, doors close at 8:10p. COST TO ATTEND IS $10.

For questions contact [masked] |[masked]

Can't make this one? visit us at www.turnonny.us
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8OWkv9zms4E

results.description:
About this Event

One Line Description:
Free, live virtual workshop focused on how to answer those tough interview questions, plus a live Q&A with our Founder & CEO, Emily Miethner.

Hashtag: #FindSpark


 Why Attend

Everyone gets nervous before an interview, but knowing how to be prepared for any question can help calm your nerves. Learn how people have responded to the toughest interview questions through real examples.

This 45 minute workshop will be held by none other than our fabulous and fearless leader, Emily Miethner. She promises that by the end of this workshop you will feel equipped with all the tools you need to quickly and actionably bring your career development to the next level!

Workshop will be about 45 minutes for presentation, with a 15 minute Q&A.


Testimonials 

“Emily is a great teacher because she’s genuine and passionate about what she’s talking about.”

“Emily has tons of first hand experience when it comes to networking and making connections. This class provided some GREAT advice on all sorts of things from how to meet new people, find cool events or how to write an efficient email. The best part was Emily had many personal anecdotes throughout the class that she would share. I would definitely recommend this class to, it really gets you in the mindset you need to start reaching out and get stuff done!”


Register here: findspark.com/tell-me-about-yourself-registration/

results.description:
• ABSOLUTELY NO CLEATS ALLOWED! NO EXCEPTIONS!!

• Permit Disclosure: No permit but field is usually unoccupied at this time.

• BRING AN ALL WHITE SHIRT (your teammates can see you better when you wear white under the fluorescent vests)

• We play rain or shine!

(Leader- Mohit.)

(Co-leader- Chris W.)

• PLEASE ARRIVE ON TIME - 8PM!! Game starts at 8:15pm sharp .

• NO BALL SMASHING! THIS IS A SPECIAL NIGHT BALL!

• Full rules explained at the game.

Be Positive - Constructive criticism after the game is way better than you yelling at me and complaining during the game.

Be Safe - Want to kick someone really hard? go take jiujitsu. We like our shins.

Be 2! - Play as a team. It take 2 to complete each pass.

Be Generous! - Not just your money (though it helps). We want clapping and good cheers.

The proceeds go to our charity network: http://ps2g.org/charities

All RSVPs are final. No credits or refunds. (It's all for charity anyway)

If the game is cancelled, get a refund by filling out this form.

If you can't afford the meetup fees, please visit our website to learn how to become a game leader. Game Leaders play for free. http://ps2g.org/gameleaders

PS2G raises money for charities that use soccer for social good restoring dignity where it's been lost through the game of soccer. We share the impact of this movement through multiple channels and promote generosity on the field through safe and supportive play.

PS2G - Local Game. Global Change. 

Disclaimer By taking part in group activities you hereby are agreeing to the rules and regulation of the meetup. In addition, you acknowledge you are volunteering to play at your own self will and at your own risk. Neither organizer nor assistant organizers are responsible for any injuries or mishaps while partaking in the games. We encourage love of the game and for each other. We encourage friendly competition. Organizers reserve the right to remove players from the game if they refuse to be friendly.

(Leader- Mohit.)

(Co-leader- Chris W.)

results.description:
Tonight’s FREE Conference Call in about ONE HOUR!

New October Conference call number and code


(712)[masked]


Access code

<a href="https://www.freeconferencecall.com/profile#"></a>[masked]

You will LISTEN ONLY to my clients in my Mentoring Course! 

We have 35 Meetup Groups Coast to Coast!

From one of the members (Berry) of my Meetup Group in Atlanta: short sale: Got a CALL FROM A MOTIVATED SELLER FROM MY SIGN LOOKING TO GET RID OF HIS HOUSE ASAP. It is upside down & a short sale.

OK Berry,

Will be talking about marketing using signs on the Tuesday night conference call.
(I may have you on that call? Talking about your experience?)

I just saw this morning that Georgia & New Mexico are in the top ten states for foreclosure/short sale?

We will make some time to talk today after 6pm. About 15 minutes? It will be a conference call with all of my coaching clients invited to listen in.

I will be asking a lot of questions... Be prepared with answers:
(All of the basics of any "package") 

Do you have any training on how to do short sales? Yes? No? Who? Or what training?
(Most is garbage)

I have invested about $20,000 (over 10 years) with one of the best and closed about 20 deals & made over $200,000 just from short sales. (Out of my over 250 deals closed)

For every 25-50 that I pre-screen, I only get about one that is worth pursuing that I can close at a price / amount that works?

They can be very time consuming. Average at least 4-6 months depending on the state & lender? Can be even longer?

Not the best thing for a "newbie" as it requires a lot of good training.

Unless you are prepared to do all of the work for a bird dog fee? Because it will take so much of my time, and my focus is to wholesale it.

My last short sale I did in Houston (I closed in about 6 weeks) with a coaching client who paid me $3,000 for my training.

I am thinking about 9pm EST your time? (8pm CST my time) Does that work for you?

Thank you,
Mark
results.name: TONIGHT! Marketing/Signs/Short Sales & MORE!

results.description:
We are an independent referrals group dedicated to the business growth of each of our members.  We welcome one member per business category in our membership.    Our 15 members are friendly and focused on supporting one another.  We'd like to grow to 20-25 members - will you join us?

This Meetup group helps us reach business professionals like you.  We welcome guests to visit us in order to network, get to know us, and decide if there's a membership 'fit'.

As an independent group, our dues stay with us and we use them to invest in our weekly meetings with a hot breakfast - as well as public networking events and member-only professional development programs.

Our 'rules' are relaxed compared to other referral groups.  For example, we don't require a sub if you can't make a meeting and our attendance policy allows for an occasional absence.  Instead of fines, we reward our members when they bring in guests.


We don't have a 'requirement' to bring in a referral every single week because we only want qualified introductions - and we know that a connection for another member may not show itself every single week.

We meet weekly to generate solid business referrals for each other. Join us and we’ll talk up your business, too. Partners in Business members have one focus . . . to exchange qualified business referrals.

We cater to the early morning professional, meeting on Tuesdays from 7:00-8:30am.  RSVP and be our GUEST at the next scheduled meeting. For further details, please see our website at Partners in Business.
results.how_to_find_us: www.partnersinbusinessnj.com
results.name: Partners in Business: North Jersey Referrals Group Weekly Meetup

results.description:
Come join us for an invigorating breakfast and networking event.

There will be at least 15 members at each meeting, regardless of how many people RSVP on Meetup.

Meet successful business owners from different professions to give and pass referrals and grow your personal network.

BNI, the largest business networking organization in the world, is a business and professional referral organization that allows only one person from each profession to join a chapter.  Belonging to BNI is like having dozens of sales people working for you because all the other members carry several copies of your business cards around with them. When they meet someone who could use your products or services they hand your card out and recommend your services. It's as simple as that!  

For 28 years BNI has used a simple but elegant philosophy that exemplifies membership, "Givers Gain," or, "what goes around comes around."

 Last year alone, Business Network Int'l generated over 7.1 million referrals resulting in more than $3.3 billion worth of business for its members!

In Manhattan, BNI currently has more than 1250 members in 53 Chapters. 

BRING LOTS OF BUSINESS CARDS!!!
Cost is $20, which includes breakfast.

results.description:
New York Passive House (NYPH) is pleased to promote this Building Energy Exchange (BEEx) Event 

- REGISTER BY CLICKING HERE -

Energy efficiency projects continue to be a focus for building owners, engineers, and other key building stakeholders. Upgrading systems like lighting, HVAC, and lighting controls can yield significant cost and energy savings but once a project is completed, how do we measure the success of our efforts? More importantly, how do we sustain those savings and identify additional opportunities?

Join Building Energy Exchange for a discussion of the strategies and tools to interpret data and continuously optimize a building's performance through proper tracking and dashboarding. Gregg Fischer of Trane Comprehensive Solutions will discuss the challenges and benefits of the continuous M&V process through the lens of their successful projects.

Dan Palino of New Water Street Corp will discuss the continuous commissioning process at 55 Water Street, the second largest privately owned office building in the United States. Containing a state-of-the-art thermal storage chiller plan, the building's management team is committed to delivering the highest level of building performance in order to benefit the environment and its tenants. From active monitoring and alarm tools to dynamic visualization of thousands of data points, the team is turning data into building intelligence to create a high performance building. 

MODERATOR

Chris Jones, Intelligent Services Leader, Trane

SPEAKERS

Gregg Fischer, PE, LEED AP O+M, Product Developer, Comprehensive Solutions, Trane

Dan Palino, Vice President of Building Systems, New Water Street Corporation


- REGISTER BY CLICKING HERE -
results.name: What Gets Measured Gets Done: Beyond M&V (BEEx Event)

- Phil Libin (Co-Founder and Former CEO of Evernote, and Managing Director of General Catalyst Partners)

The best one-sentence pitch from the Startup Founder 101 community will have a chance to pitch their business idea to Phil Libin and Adeo Ressi on this webinar, live via webcam! To be considered, submit your one-sentence pitch at http://bit.ly/sf101-pitch by end of day Sunday, October 25. results.description:
RSVP HERE: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/show-and-tell-carlos-gonzalez-from-product-school-tickets-18887072743

SHOW AND TELL - Brown Bag Lunch Series

This brown bag series will give you the opportunity to hear NYU students or recent alums talk about their experiences as entrepreneurs. They will present their ideas, projects, and/or products; share their biggest fears, challenges, and achievements; and talk about job opportunities on their teams. And of course, answer your questions!

Topic of the talk: The importance of product management in entrepreneurship.

Product management is an essential role in every tech company today, whether it is an enterprise or a startup. Entrepreneurs need training in the fundamental product management skills in order to build great products. Carlos will touch on what is product management and how these skills help entrepreneurs be successful.

Speaker:

Product School is an educational company that offers courses and workshops on product management in software and tech companies.

Carlos Gonzalez de Villaumbrosia Carlos is CEO at Product School. He has seven years of experience building teams and digital products on 3 Continents. He is a three times company Co-founder. Before Product School, he was the Lead Instructor of Product Management at General Assembly and Co-founder and CEO of Floqq (invested by 500Startups), the biggest marketplace for online video courses in Latin America.
results.name: Ask Me Anything about Product Management, Startups or Entrepreneurship

Hill Rose

More than 70% of marketers struggle with measuring the impact of their branding campaigns because they measure the wrong metrics. 

Join us for our webinar with Eventbrite’s Global Director of Metro Marketing, Eric Meyerson, to hear how Eventbrite successfully uses data to track brand awareness and monitor the competition. 

We'll also share tips for quick and easy brand research.

- Learn how to set brand benchmarks to effectively track your brand campaigns

- Frame your data properly for market entry considerations

results.description:
The Queen's Code Book Club 

Tuesdays from 3PM - 4:30PM — Includes 1 hour of teaching, and 30 minutes of LIVE Q&A
8 Sessions — Beginning on October 27, 2015


“It may seem like we have to choose between honoring men or honoring women. The battle of the sexes, right? If we operate from instinct, this will continue to be true. But, by understanding our conflicting instincts, we can move above and beyond to create love, admiration and respect for both genders.” — Alison 

This is a virtual book club with Alison Armstrong

Beginning in October, we’ll be reading and discussing a chapter a week during a special 90 minute call with Alison herself! She will be taking the book chapter-by-chapter each week beginning October 27, going behind the story, elaborating on the concepts, and filling in where Claudia says “perhaps we can talk about that later.” She will also be turning the self-reflection of the characters into growth opportunities for YOU.

This extraordinary event will be hosted by The Shift Network. They will be opening registration for this event at the end of September, and the link to register will be posted here as soon as it goes live. 

DATE: Starting Oct 27, 2015 - 8 weekly sessions on Tuesdays

TIME: 3PM - 4:30PM EST

WHERE: Virtual - register online at http://queenscodecourse.com

results.description:
Join this special free LIVE online event from across the world.

With meditation and visualisation, this powerful 30 minute broadcast features beautiful sounds and music to uplift, energise and inspire.

Experience the benefit of the enhanced collective energy of meditating with other people, whilst being in the comfort of your own home or office.

Each meditation includes an introduction, followed by a time in which to meditate in whatever way is easy and natural to you.

You are then guided through a visualisation enabling you to focus on living your ideal life.

Participating Live:

The broadcast begins promptly at 3.00pm and finishes at 3.30pm.

***Please click to join Meditation 101 Live at the scheduled broadcast time ***

Please note that the meditation and visualisation are pre-recorded to ensure sound quality however participation with other people from across the world is live.

Meditation 101 Live works best with the following internet browsers: Internet Explorer, Chrome, Safari and Opera.

If you need any technical help connecting to Meditation 101 Live please click here.

Testimonials:

"That was absolutely amazing! I don't think I have ever fully let go and quieted my mind like that before. I feel so inspired. By the end of the session I was filled with so much love - love for myself, for others, and love coming from Source. Unconditional, pure love. Thank you." C.L.

group.name: The Law of Attraction Centre™ (East Coast)

results.description:
Are you ready to dive into a call of FEARLESS RELATING with three of the most dynamic relationship geeks on the planet today? Come blow your mind and open your heart with vulnerability diva Monique Darling, reality hacker Lawrence Lanoff and sex and relationship expert Reid Mihalko. If you could have anything, do anything, what would you choose? What do you really want? What is keeping you from having it?
Life is actually fairly simple - lies, beliefs and bulllshit make it complicated - because they confuse reality.
Freedom comes from seeing reality clearly. Reality is ecstasy because it’s all about dropping myths.
Right now you may be living life chasing windmills that you believe are GIANTS -There are giants all right - giant piles of BS and because we are spinning our wheels in giant piles of BS (belief systems) that are completely out of touch with reality.
But reality is out there. It’s possible to come in contact with, and when you do, it’s life changing.
And part of waking up is really about stepping out of the womb of myth and stories.
"A myth is a fixed way of looking at the world which cannot be destroyed because, looked at through the myth, all evidence supports that myth"~Edward Bono

During this hour call, Reid Mihalko, Monique Darling, and Lawrence Lanoff will each share their top myth busting piece around fearless relating
take a few of your deepest relationship questions
and tell you about a weekend of events that could alter your way of relating with everyone in your life beginning with YOU!!

We will also be talking about our AMAZING week of events, all on Fearless Relating, happening in Calgary Dec 2-6 as the incredible Rovena Skye hosts us again

This free amazing call will take place Tues Oct 27 from 1-2 PM MST
It will be recorded if you can't make it live
But you must sign up through eventbrite to get the call in information
RSVP HERE: https://fearlessrelatingteleconference.eventbrite.com About Your Facilitators:
Sex and relationship expert Reid Mihalko of www.ReidAboutSex.com helps adults create more self-esteem, self-confidence and greater health in their relationships and sex lives using an inspiring mixture of humor and knowledge. Reid’s workshops and college lectures have been attended by close to 40,000 men and women. He has appeared in media such as Oprah’s Our America With Lisa Ling on OWN, the Emmy award-winning talk show Montel, Dr. Phil’s The Doctors on CBS, Bravo’s Miss Advised, Fox News, in Newsweek, Seventeen, GQ, The Washington Post, and in thirteen countries and at least seven languages.

Monique Darling, San Diego, CA, Authenticity, Vulnerability and Relationship coach is the founder of Juicy Enlightenment which provides workshops and experiential play-shops in the art of Tantra and conscious loving. She has studied and taught with renowned Tantra teachers and extraordinary workshop facilitators since 1990 and is a certified Cuddly Party Facilitator. She has been featured on TLC and The Dr’s and has been interviewed by magazines across the USA. Monique is dedicated to empowering others utilizing her vast repertoire of cutting-edge teachings. She specializes is helping others reclaim their power and natural sensuality by transmuting fear and repression into courage, self-love and freedom. She guides from a place of understanding and her natural exuberance is infectious! She is available for private sessions, experiential workshops and Cuddle Parties. www.juicyenlightenment.com
She is devoted to helping YOU uncover your magnificence!!! To empower YOU, who dream of something more, to awaken further and discover it is within you. You have all the answers, let her help you remember the questions.

Lawrence Lanoff, Sedona, AZ is one of the most fascinating people on the teaching landscape. Truly a renaissance man, Lawrence is a film director, photographer, author and a deeply enlightened healer and teacher. He calls himself a “rubber meets the road kinda guy” as he applies this practical essence to his artistic and spiritual skills over a 20 year span, to an amazing array of disciplines, starting with a couple of dream jobs – the directing of movies and as a photographer for Playboy Magazine.
Over the past several years, Lawrence has been in a process of refining his radical teachings, leading people into a new kind of freedom, literally deprogramming them from the sleep imposed by cults and religions. What is slowly evolving is a revolutionary new theory of consciousness that incorporates evolution, symbolism, metaphor, neurobiology, and their relationship to healing, spiritual evolution, and neuro-economics — the neural pathways that influences our deepest feelings about self worth and money, and, of course, sex and relationships.
http://www.lawrencelanoff.com/
results.name: Fearless Relating by destroying myths *FREE* Teleconference Call

More than 70% of marketers struggle with measuring the impact of their branding campaigns because they measure the wrong metrics. 

Join us for our webinar with Eventbrite’s Global Director of Metro Marketing, Eric Meyerson, to hear how Eventbrite successfully uses data to track brand awareness and monitor the competition. 

We'll also share tips for quick and easy brand research. 


Key Takeaways: 


- Learn how to set brand benchmarks to effectively track your brand campaigns


- Understand key metrics for measuring your brand


- Frame your data properly for market entry considerations


- Get tips for monitoring the varying competition across metro areas


Speakers

Eric Meyerson, Global Director of Metro Marketing at Eventbrite 

Chuck Brinker, Director of Research Solutions at SurveyMonkey

group.name: Blog A Business Card School & Support Group for Bloggers.

results.description:
A self-taught photographer, Keziban Barry has spent her career crafting cinematic images and artistic short films. From her travel around the world to her work with National Geographic Adventure Magazine and Art+Auction, Kezi draws upon a rich visual library that helps her construct images that hint at a life beyond the stills that she presents. 
http://photos4.meetupstatic.com/photos/event/a/a/f/4/600_443323764.jpegDuring this seminar, Keziban explores the psychology of being a photographer and image maker. Delving into how she discovered and became enamored of photography, Keziban will speak on how her career has grown; the many literary, musical, cinematic, and historical references that her work alludes to; and the process of how she constructs her bewitching images. Keziban will close her seminar with a discussion of what it means to be a photographer in today’s world before opening to questions from the audience.

Keziban Barry's seminar will be available in two (2) sessions - one at 4 PM and one at 6 PM. Please RSVP for the session that works for you!

ABOUT KEZIBAN BARRY:

Keziban Barry grew up in Massachusetts on a private school campus where her father taught Mathematics and her mother mentored students on career development. While attending both Phillips Academy Andover and Georgetown University, Keziban traveled the world on different programs to further her education in languages, music, and service work. It was during these travels she discovered her love of photography. Keziban developed her style by infusing her work with literary, musical, cinematic and historical references as well as through observing the human experience.

After graduating from college, Keziban moved to Costa Rica where she had her first experience creating and directing a documentary. Keziban then landed in New York where she was hired as a photo editor at National Geographic Adventure Magazine. Working amongst some of the best photographers, editors and journalists in the industry helped fine tune her visual storytelling skills. Before it folded in 2009, she led the Art+Auction and Modern Painters visual design team and photographed many of today’s leading artists. Since 2011, Keziban works solely as a professional photographer and continues to roam the world for inspiration. Her work has been shown at the International Center of Photography and the Norwood Club, as well as having been published in several major publications. She continues to delve into the world of cinematic storytelling by creating artistic short films and personal projects that push the boundaries of her photography.
results.name: The Psychology of an Image with Keziban Barry

results.description:
It's getting cold out there. Let's do something to warm things up.

Please join 100 Lawyers Strong, our Attorney Members, Network Affiliates and Friends, as we work together to help those NY'ers who need coats (as well as hats, gloves and any other lightly worn clothing you can spare) this winter season.


We are partnering with our friends at Green Tree Textiles as well as other local organizations and charities to help make a difference. This event is FREE for all 100 Lawyers Strong Members/Affiliates and those making clothing donations. Enjoy a 2 for 1 happy hour from 5-7PM for all those donating at this worthwhile charity event. Others may purchase their tickets below or HERE (if you wish to attend this event for no charge please see below to join the Network). Complimentary appetizers will be served. A full menu will also be available during the event.

Also, for those who are looking for a reason to dress up for the holiday, come wearing a cop, robber or other Halloween costume and enjoy complimentary beverages from 5-6PM courtesy of our happy hour sponsor.

If you have not already joined 100 Lawyers Strong, please visit www.100lawyers.com to register and create your own, personalized web profile today and connect with other attorneys, post about yourself and your practice and share referrals on our exclusive Referral Exchange Board.


STRENGTH IN NUMBERS!

Transit: 2 or 5 trains to E 174th St stop and short walk. 5 train runs express until 7PM from E 149th St-Third Ave to E 180th St. BX17, BX21 and BX11 within walking distance.

Ready? Play.
_____________________________________________________

What will we be doing at the Meetup?
We will be meeting at the tennis courts for some friendly rallying, doubles, and singles play*. This meetup is open to players at any skill level; from beginner to advanced.

*For those of you who are interested in singles play, please keep in mind that the ability to play singles predicates on the amount of members who have RSVPed as well as court availability at the meetup event's venue. We cannot guarantee singles play in every instance.

How long will the meetup be?
The time listed for the meetup event is when you can expect to the event host to be there. If you would like to arrive earlier or later than the start time listed, please leave a comment in the meetup event you plan to attend. This will give everyone in attendance a good representation of who is showing up at what time.

What will it be like?
Our group is very friendly and loosely organized to allow for a fun experience.

Upon arrival, our event host will announce which court they are on in the comments of the meetup event. If you have a smartphone, we strongly suggest that you download the Meetup app for iPhone or Android to make communication easier.

When you arrive at the courts, look for the event host listed or other members of the group playing on (or near) the courts listed. Use the photos of each host/member on the website as a frame of reference.


Introduce yourself. Let the host know your level of play and you will be assigned to a court immediately.

Do members need to bring anything?
All members must bring their own racquet. Unfortunately, we do not supply racquets.

All members are encouraged to bring a fresh can of new balls. You can always use a marker to mark your initials on your ball if you would like to keep them for future play. Please keep in mind that tennis balls only last a couple of days after taking them out of the can before they lose their bounce.

If you plan to donate to the group, you can leave your donation with the meetup event host or the head organizer, Frank, if he’s in attendance. All donations go towards the fees required to organize the meetup.

Who should come? Are newcomers welcome?
Our meetup event is open to all players whether they're an absolute beginner or an advanced player. Players will be matched up with others based on their skill level. Beginners will be given an opportunity to play with higher level players so they can gain more experience with higher consistency.

It is a high priority for our group to help beginners increase their skill and become better players. If you are reading this and are an absolute beginner, please don't be intimidated. We want you to join us and have fun.

What should a newcomer expect?
If you're new to the group, you'll learn very quickly that our community is extremely friendly. We have a colorful cast of characters from all walks of life who are ready and willing to have a good time.

Whether you're interested in easy-going rallying or competitive play, we can accommodate you.

Questions?
If you have any other questions, concerns, or comments; please send them to our head organizer, Frank Tirado via email.

results.description:
5:30pm Doors Open

6:00pm DevFest Announcement: 

GDG North Jersey, GDG New York and GDG Hudson Valley  are organizing a 48-hour "DevFest" hackathon on Nov 7-8. We'll share some early information about this.


Organizers: Todd & Sylvia (GDG NJ),Hendrix (GDG HV), Dario & Ralph (GDG NY), Nitya (GDG NY & GDG HV)


6:15pm FEATURED TALK: POLYMER 1.0(Speaker: Jeff Posnick, Google)

Polymer reached 1.0 status in June 2015, followed by an extremely informative Polymer Summit in September. This is the time to get started with Polymer if you haven't already done so!! Jeff Posnick (Developer Advocate for Chrome @Google) will do a deep-dive into Polymer 1.0.

7:00pm 

Presto: Gestural Interfaces for Android Wear (Speaker: Sumeet Thadani)

Learn to build applications which respond to Hand Gestures (snaps, flicks, and other hand movements). This session will cover implementation of the Presto library, which uses sensor data from Android Wear devices to build a new category of UI. Participants will be shown how to build a simple working gesture application and learn best practices for working with gesture. Details at http://presto.watch.


Speaker Bio: Sumeet is the founder of Presto, which makes it easy to integrate gesture interfaces into any application paired with Android Wear. Formerly he worked at Wall Street firms in Algorithmic Trading, and was also a founding member of the LimeWire team.

7:30pm 

"Redefining watch faces for Android Wear" (Speakers: Shaun Tollerton, Vasiliy Kulakov, Jim VanNest)

Speaker Bios: ustwo is a digital product studio that works with brands to launch products, and that has also been creating things for the Android Wear community since 2014. Shaun Tollerton (@tollerton) is the Product Designer on ustwo watch faces with Vasiliy Kulakov (@ReallyVasiliy) as the Developer and Jim VanNest (@jimvannest) handling Quality Assurance.

8:00pm 

Firebase + X : Lightning Talks (5 mins each)

Firebase is billed as a "Backend as a Service" product where developers can effectively build an application by working only with a front-end technology, allowing Firebase to act as both the real-time database and the application hosting environment.  

We are looking for lightning talks that feature usage of Firebase with different front-end technologies. Sign up if you want to speak on the topic or have an app to show.

8:30pm Close
results.name: Oct GDG: Polymer 1.0, Android Wear (& DevFest)

results.description:
International superwoman Julia Rhee -venture capital wiz, FinTech start-up founder,  CNBC Asia anchor and financial and government event planner (she also co-throws amazing FinTech Friday parties at her home with this event organizer) will speak to Byte Academy students and a limited number of guests.  Topics will include the international FinTech scene, venture capital funding, women in business and the ups and downs of a start-up.

Ms. Rhee recently launched her FinTech start-up Coinages.  She is on the board and co-founding member of TextVA, artificial intelligence database for real estate transactions;  and, is a founder and managing partner of Alpha Institutes, an event planning company for financial institutions and governments (in fact she will have completed an event for the Goverment of Korea before speaking to Byte students and community members).  A graduate of Juilliard, she founded Music Traveler, an AirBnB for musicians.  Ms. Rhee has her minister's license and continues her studies at the London School of Economics and Political Science while still focusing on her business ventures.

About Byte Academy: Byte Academy is a coding bootcamp in New York City with full and part-time programs in Full Stack Python development, FinTech (financial technology), Data Sciences and MedTech (medical technology). As the first coding bootcamp with a FinTech (Finance Technology) program, Byte Academy focuses on developing industry-specific technology skills in its students. Byte Academy’s original full-time bootcamp was the first to teach Python programming in New York City. All women are eligible for $2,000 scholarships to Byte Academy.

Byte Academy is Pleased to Announce It Is Now Accepting Applications For November Part-Time FinTech, Python and Data Science Classes

Please see www.byteacademy.co for more details and 
follow us @byteacademyco (twitter) byteacademy (Facebook & Instagram)

results.description:
Co-sponsored by New Jersey Creatives Network, NJCN.  

You spend nearly a third of your life working so it stands to reason that certain things are going to get on your nerves.  Business challenges are not just about dealing with associates, clients, affiliates or freelance employment recruiters.  No matter where you  work, you will encounter  individuals and situations that make you want to  scream!  Learning  how to handle some of the biggest challenges in the workplace today will serve you well regardless of your position at the company.  From obnoxious loud talkers to time wasting meetings, we’ll look at some of the biggest workplace annoyances, stresses and irritations and talk about ways to address them.

You will:

•  Gain a better understanding of how others deal with common workplace annoyances

• Find out what does and doesn't work to resolve annoyances

• Learn new strategies to counter annoyances

• Find out which annoyances can actually boost creativity

• Enjoy humorous and not-so-humorous stories from fellow attendees

•  Meet members of NJCN, our co-sponsor -  a unique opportunity to network with other interesting freelance IT Professionals.

Led by Linda Trignano:

Linda Trignano, an accomplished speaker on communication skills provides coaching and consulting to managers and teams to improve communications and increase productivity.  Through her firm, Trignano Consulting, LLC, she helps create communication programs that transform the way people and business groups communicate, connect and collaborate with their customers. 

Utilizing DiSC assessments, she focuses on three critical areas – how you speak, how you come across to others and improving your online image.  Depending on your needs, she will customize programs to include one-on-one consulting, workshops, seminars and keynote speaking.  She may be reached at <a>[masked]</a>.  Linda also provides Grief in the Workplace coaching & consulting to managers, individuals and teams to help the manager, grieving employee and team reach understanding, balance and improved productivity on their journey through loss and serious illness.

$5.00 for preregistered AWC-NNJ members, $10 for pre-registered non-members and $15.00 at the door.  Workshop begins promptly at 6:30 PM.  Cost includes dinner (sandwiches, lite fare, and refreshments served between 5:30 - 6:30 PM).

results.description:
REV = Reforming the Energy Vision 

In tandem with our work to shut down the bad stuff like Port Ambrose LNG, the AIM Pipeline, and other fracking infrastructure, we have to prep for our RENEWABLE FUTURE and make sure that we build a new economy. REV is the process by which New York State decides its energy future. It's the public's chance to say what we want and how we want to be involved in the future. It's our chance to advocate for community-decided energy, more renewables and a future without fracked gas, nuclear, or fossil fuels. 

Before the hearing we'll rally in Washington Square Park:

We'll join with the Energy Democracy Alliance crew, one of our alliance groups, in Washington Square Park for a little rally & hot coffee meet-up. Look for us on the south side of the fountain. Then we'll go as a group to the hearing.

The hearing is at New York University School of Law, Vanderbilt Hall  
Tishman Auditorium,
40 Washington Square South Between MacDougal and Sullivan Streets. 

The hearing opens at 6:30;
Public Statements begin at 7.
results.name: TESTIFY AT THE REV HEARING

We focus on creating long term relationships, not just hard selling products and services. This helps you build social capital among the members of our local community on an ongoing basis. We encourage you to leverage these relationships to enhance the value of our events and your business.  

Network with members and interact with our sponsor companies who will showcase their business-related products and services.

We look forward to seeing you at this event!


COST: $15.00 prepaid (100 available) or $25.00 cash/door. 

PREPAY ON EVENTBRITE BY CLICKING HERE 

PREPAY NOTE: Unfortunately Meetup is not using Paypal Payments anymore. They have started using a new WePay Program. If you'd like to prepay for our next event, click on the Eventbrite link above to pay in advance. 

VENDOR TABLES AVAILABLE!

•  Table for marketing materials (flyers, brochures, etc.)

•  Two Square-top tables: $300+PayPal fees (incl 3 staff)

OCTOBER VENDORS SO FAR INCLUDE:  

Note: Each month we donate 1 vendor table to a worthwhile nonprofit to help spread awareness of their cause. Know a great non-profit? Send them our way. 

JOBS CONNECTED
Jobs Connected is a networking company which uses cutting-edge technology to bring business professionals together. Users can search for jobs, employees, and business services. Our search engine is smarter than our competitors’ and we use personality assessments to match job seekers to a position that fits them best. We are the only networking site that has video chat functionality; allowing interviews and entire job fairs to be conducted online. Visit The Website

results.description:
Yes! You saw it right. Taco Tuesday! Mike and I have been talking about giving ya'll more tacos in your week. The group is blowing up and there are tacos everywhere so we have decided to do a series of Taco Tuesday's in Manhattan. Manhattan is my domain but Mike will be keeping BK live on Thursdays. I will be doing these every other Tuesday to start so expect greatness when we do roll.


And without further adieu, ... Tacombi.

When Tacombi was born a few years ago, I knew I had to be there. It's retro design made to look like an old garage/restaurant in Mexico it had me at hello. The menu initially designed by Chef Aaron Sanchez (Yes, That dude from Chopped) had lots of classics on it. The concept, bring that classic Mexican food and feel to Manhattan with a "cheffy" touch and the result is success! Since then, Tacombi has spawned multiple locations but I am taking you to the original.


With Tacos served out of an old retired VW van in the middle of the joint it's not to be missed! The flavors are simple,  amazing and they have great cocktails and auga frescas to boot. Join me for the first ever Taco Tuesday! It's going to be delicious, decadent and fun! Looking forward to the combo!

DeRM

results.description:
Unfortunately, I have plans I cannot cancel, but I thought there might be interest in this free event at Cooper Union.

 
"Timed to the 111th anniversary of the opening of the New York City subway on October 27, 1904, a group of historians and designers gather for a public symposium focusing on the past and future evolution of one of New York City's most key graphic works: the subway map."

PLEASE RSVP HERE in addition to signing up for the meetup: http://www.eventbrite.com/e/the-subway-map-the-last-50-years-the-next-50-years-tickets-18482657125?aff=es2


Participants

R. Raleigh D'Adamo, whose innovative map for the Transit Authority (TA) led the TA to jettison their long-standing three-colour mapping scheme, and to adopt a scheme in which each route is colour-coded. The same concept is still used today. 


John Tauranac, who led the 1970s committee that created the quasi-geographic subway map that has lasted (with some changes, additions and deletions) for 35 years.
Peter B Lloyd, historian of the subway map and author of Vignelli: Transit Maps (RIT Press, 2012). 


Eddie Jabbour, principal of Kick Design, a branding agency. With his son Dan, he designed the KickMap transit app, which has had more than a million downloads and has been featured in several books on information design and mapping. 


Joe Brennan, renowned for his scholarship on the subway, who has for twenty years been maintaining a subway map that has garnered much praise.

Sarah M. Kaufman, Assistant Director for the Technology Programming at the NYU Rudin Center for Transportation. She formerly worked at the MTA, where she led the Open Data program and created a conference and online exchange between the MTA and software developers. That program provides the foundation for the many subway map apps for mobile devices that are now on the market.

Program

Introduction by Peter B. Lloyd: Why is the transit map an 'ínformation design' problem? 


Presentation by R. Raleigh D'Adamo on how he created his 1964 map. 


Presentation by Peter B Lloyd on how the map evolved after 1964. 


Presentation by John Tauranac: who will show how to make today’s MTA subway map into the MTA subway map of tomorrow 


Presentation by Eddie Jabbour on present and future transit mapping for mobile devices. 


Panel discussion on how the subway map should evolve in the future.
results.name: The Subway Map: The Last 50 Years, the Next 50 Years

We are excited to host the fourth gathering of a Community of Practice of people who are passionate about evolving organizations to reflect our emerging human consciousness.

REGISTER HERE:
http://www.eventbrite.com/e/teal-organizations-nyc-community-of-practice-tickets-18662665535 

We will begin the conversation assuming a general level of knowledge that includes at least having read Frederic Laloux's book and focus on the actual practice of developing "teal" organizations. (If you haven't read the book but would like to get a 10-minute summary of the main concepts, we recommend checking out this video:

https://vimeo.com/121517508


The format of the evening will be primarily interactive and participatory and consist mostly of small and whole group dialogues where we will explore some key questions, challenges and opportunities that are showing up in our work around this theme.

Spaces are limited, but if we fill up quickly we will look for a bigger space. And we are planning to host more of these gatherings, so if you can't make this one look for our November CoP announcement!

Please Note: Refunds will not be given for this event.

http://www.eventbrite.com/e/teal-organizations-nyc-community-of-practice-tickets-18662665535

UPCOMING NYC HOLACRACY TASTER WORKSHOP


Wednesday, Oct 21, 2015

Is your organization agile and adaptive to its environment - even as it scales? Are the functions and roles within your organization clear, yet also continually evolving, and driven by those doing the work?

This workshop introduces Holacracy: a "social technology" for structuring, governing, and running a company. Holacracy fundamentally changes how decisions are made and how power is distributed.

Learn More & Register Here: 

http://events.holacracy.org/events/nyc-holacracy-taster-workshop-2015-10

We are a very informal group consisting mostly of web developers and IT consultants, with the occasional application developer thrown into the mix. We talk about the latest projects we're working on and get help and feedback from each other.

The meetup starts at 6 pm but running as late as 10 or 11 pm (sometimes even later!) is the norm. People typically arrive anytime between 6 pm and 9 pm, so don't miss out just because you can't get there by 6. There's usually an early crowd and a late crowd.

US Citizenship- is designed to guide permanent residents through the process of obtaining US citizenship. The course accepts students of all levels and prepares them to pass the USCIS civics, reading, and writing tests. In one semester the course can bring those already studying to proficiency, or in a few semesters prepare complete novices. The course has one prerequisite, a level 2 or above understanding of English.

Ciudadanía de los EE UU - está clase es diseñada para guiar a los residentes permanentes de los Estados Unidos a través del proceso para obtener la ciudadanía estadounidense. El curso acepta estudiantes de todos los niveles y los prepara para saber la información que se requiere en las preguntas cívicas de USCIS. Los alumnos practicaran leer y contestar las preguntas del examen de ciudadanía. Después de un un semestre en el curso, los alumnos que están activamente estudiando para el examen de ciudadanía conseguirán la capacidad de pasar el examen. Despues de un par de semestres el el curso, alumnos principiantes estaran totalmente preparados. El unico requisito del curso de ciudadanía es la capacidad de comprensión de inglés de por lo menos el segundo nivel.

results.description:
From Studio Toho, the masterminds behind the GODZILLA franchise and acclaimed director Shinji Higuchi (THE FLOATING CASTLE), comes ATTACK ON TITAN Part 2: End of the World!

STORYLINE:

After a century of relative peace, the people within the walls are growing restless. A young man named Eren and his friends Armin and Mikasa venture to the wall’s edge with the hopes of seeing what’s on the other side. But before they can get there, the unthinkable happens; a Titan larger and more fierce than any that have been seen before breaches the wall, kicking a large hole through the base of it.

Now, a once isolated world is flooded with seemingly indestructible Titans, and the only way to beat them is to fight back. But the military forces Eren joins to protect humanity appear to be protecting some secrets of their own. The future looks bleak, but there’s more to Eren than meets the eye: he may be humanity’s last hope against extinction.

It's 100 Years after Titans destroyed most of the human population. The survivors are now living in peace. That is, until a Titan bigger than anyone has ever seen breaches the wall that protects humans from the rest of the Titan infested world.

The film is based on the popular Japanese manga series ( http://shingeki.net)

www.AttackonTitanTheMovie.com

results.description:
EVENT TYPE: Dining

DESCRIPTION:
I've been here about four times now, and each time I leave incredibly satisfied. I've had the tasting menu, the hot pot, dumplings, foie gras inari, and on my way to trying every single thing on the menu. You know the food is legit when all the employees are Japanese and most of the customers are Japanese. If you're looking for a traditional Japanese food that's done well, this is the place to go. You can't go wrong with anything on the menu.

MENU:

http://www.yelp.com/menu/hakata-tonton-new-york-3/main-menu

• Foie Gras Inari

• Grilled Pork with Japanese spicy garlic sauce

• Spicy Tuna Sushi

• Japanese Crispy Wings

• Snow Carb Croquettes

RESTAURANT GALLERY:

• Dining Room

• Same Dinning Room


RESTAURANT REVIEW:

http://www.yelp.com/biz/hakata-tonton-new-york-3

http://www.meetup.com/NYCAsianMeetup/pages/Disclaimer

results.description:
There are new rules and <a>regulations</a> concerning the Tuesday <a>night</a> games. Please scroll down and read them all before signing up for the event.


There may not be space for you if you don't.


<a>Table</a> Top Role <a>Playing</a> Game Night!


 

This is the official <a>RPG game</a> night of the NY SciFi/Fan Meetup Group.

 

Every Tuesday night we get together to indulge in <a>Table Top RPGs</a>. There are <a>multiple games</a> going on at once, so getting involved in a game is <a>easy</a>.


For those of you unfamiliar with the term, a Table Top RPG (Role <a>Playing</a> Game) is a type of game where the players create characters based on the  story/system available and one person acts as a storyteller. Everyone interacts and works together to <a>create a story</a> and have a few laughs as well.


New Rules for Signing Up:


How to <a>sign up</a>: There will be at leas two <a>games running</a> each week.  You will be able to see who is running, what games are being <a>played</a>, and who is <a>playing</a> below. There will be a total of six spots <a>open</a> in each game, so if a game has filled up you will not be able to join that game. 


When you <a>sign up</a>, leave a comment stating which game you would like to participate in and your name will be added to the roster. If you would like to leave a game or switch over to another game in <a>progress</a>, simply speak to Justin or Cat. They will let you know if there is <a>open</a> space to do so.


If it is your first time <a>attending</a> a game, we have pre-made characters for you to <a>select</a> from. Beginning on your third RPG event, you may choose to make an original character for whatever game you're currently participating in.


Can I run my own game?: If you would like to run your own game, please contact Justin or Cat to reserve a slot.


Need Dice?: Please bring yours if you have some if you need extra I will provide some.

Games Currently Running:

Jutin: Full Steam Ahead 

A new steampunk-inspired RPG by Justin.

Cat: Monster of the Week

A game of investigating and fighting the things that go bump in the night. This campaign is set in a fictional California city a few years after WWII

Current Roster:

Liz

Joseph

Mike

Alden
results.name: NY SciFi & Fantasy Tabletop Role Playing and Game Night

results.description:
If you are interested in making your site mobile friendly, then you’ve probably heard of Bootstrap. Bootstrap of the most popular HTML, CSS, and JS framework for developing responsive, mobile first projects on the web. In this session we’ll start with a plain vanilla out of the box SharePoint site and end with a fully developed mobile web site. 

This session is not for the timid. The focus of the session is heavily bootstrap centric. The concepts apply to whether you are using bootstrap in SharePoint or anywhere else. 

We will be covering the dirty details of how to get bootstrap working inside SharePoint. We will also be modifying the masterpage and creating custom page layouts.  When you leave you’ll know exactly what it’s going to take to have a beautifully crafted mobile friendly site.

About the Speaker

Thomas Daly - is the Lead SharePoint Branding/UI developer @ B&R Business Solutions. He specializes in implementing custom SharePoint branding as well as delivering custom UI solutions.  He is an expert in web technologies and highly proficient in many languages including C#, JavaScript, jQuery, CSS, XSLT. His educational background is composed of a Bachelor’s degree in Computer Engineering and a Master’s degree in Software Engineering. Tom is also heavily involved in the SharePoint community speaking on branding at community events. He currently runs the Central Jersey SharePoint & Office 365 User Group at Microsoft - Iselin, NJ as well as the SharePoint Saturday New York & New Jersey.
results.name: The A-Z of Building a Responsive SharePoint Site with Bootstrap

results.description:
If you are new to LaunchNJ and/or unfamiliar with New Jersey's entrepreneurial ecosystem this is an event you should try to attend.

As you may already know Launch NJ’s mission is the creation of a vibrant entrepreneurial community in New Jersey. In our opinion the most underserved part of this ecosystem is the idea and early stage entrepreneurs so we have made them a top priority.

We provide educational workshops, idea validation opportunities, serial entrepreneur interaction, cofounder matching and many other programs to help aspiring entrepreneurs. There are also many other great groups around the state which can help early stage startups.

At this meeting we will be presenting information on LaunchNJ programs and the many resources available around New Jersey as well as soliciting input from members on needs that they may have.

Agenda:

6:30 – 7:00: Pizza and networking

7:00 – 7:30: New Jersey Startup community overview

7:30 – 8:00: LaunchNJ initiatives and programs

8:00 – 8:45: Q&A and discussions on programs that you would like to see

results.description:
THIS IS A PAID EVENT PURCHASE YOUR TICKET HERE

Franck Nouyrigat, Startup Weekend

Franck Nouyrigat is the co-founder of Startup Weekend and a founding member of the board of Up Global (up.co), the world's largest non-profit focusing on early stage entrepreneurs and the startup ecosystem (in 120+ countries). Since 2009 Startup Weekend and Up Global (e.g. StartupDigest) have helped more than 200,000 entrepreneurs and created more than $130M of value.

A long time innovator and entrepreneur, in 2001 he helped to organize the first Open Source conference in Paris. Franck is now based in Brooklyn where he works on the future of corporate innovation (Recorp) by leveraging the talent of successful entrepreneurs to develop internal startups and scale-ups. He was awarded MIT Innovator Under 35, spoke about entrepreneurship and innovation at TedX, and was honored to ring the opening bell at the NYSE and the closing bell at the NASDAQ. He is a guest writer at Forbes, WSJ and Les Echos.

Franck has advised hundreds of startup founders, and helped to design the first french accelerator (Le Camping). He graduated from HEC Paris in 2003 with a MS in Management, as well as a MS in Computer Science from Ecole Centrale d’Electronique (Paris) in 2002.

Agenda

6:30 Networking and Food
7:30 Fireside Chat
8:30 Networking

Hosted By Peter Crysdale, New York City Chapter Director

Peter is the Founder/CEO of StrategyHack, running marketing strategy hackathons for startups and professional marketers. He has a diverse background with 8+ years experience spanning engineering, social good and technology startups. In his spare time, he enjoys day dreaming and cross country skiing.  
Email: [masked] | Twitter: @PCrysdale

Hosted By Joshua Ness, Director of Marketing & Operations

Josh is a growth strategist in the New York City startup community. He used to produce global events for the likes of Microsoft. Now he helps marketing teams learn to think like startups.
Email: [masked] | Twitter: @jcness

Global Partners

Google is committed to empowering entrepreneurs around the world through programs, partnerships, and our products.

Local Partners

Justworks frees entrepreneurs to focus on their business and their team. Its simple platform automates HR, payments, benefits, and government paperwork while saving companies up to 30% on healthcare. Headquartered in New York City, Justworks is funded by Bain Capital Ventures, Thrive Capital and Index Ventures. Learn more at Justworks.com.

Pivotal Labs consists of fellow practitioners and startup veterans who have a history of solving problems with early stage companies.

StrategyHack teaches marketers to be leaders in problem-solving and strategy development through a live-action, hands-on workshop with real startups.

Upcoming events you should attend!

New York City hosts Ulrich Quay BMW i Ventures 2nd of December 2015

What is Startup Grind?

Startup Grind is a global startup community designed to educate, inspire, and connect entrepreneurs. We host monthly events in more than 150 cities and 65 countries featuring successful local founders, innovators, educators and investors who share personal stories and lessons learned on the road to building great companies. Our monthly fireside chat interviews, startup mixers and annual conferences provide ample opportunities to connect with amazing startups and the people behind them, tap into a strong support network, form meaningful connections and gain inspiration for the startup journey ahead. For more information visit StartupGrind.com or follow us on twitter @StartupGrind.
results.name: Startup Grind New York City Hosts Franck Nouyrigat (Startup Weekend)

results.description:
Autumn is the perfect time to drink wines that pair perfectly with the foods of the Fall harvest! Taste 24 wines with the PINOT name, including favorites and other lesser-known grapes you will love to try. Enjoy a buffet of cheeses, hors d'oeuvres, and noshes with each sip! 

You will get a wine glass that you can have filled as many times as you'd like.  There are 3 tables or stations where they will be pouring the wines and explaining each one.  

Socialize and network in a relaxed atmosphere during one of our very popular walk around wine tasting events. Unlike other wine tastings where you are stuck at one table, this walk around format gives you the opportunity to easily meet other members and wine enthusiasts.  

You will enjoy up to 24 different wines all carefully explained by Vinoversity’s friendly and knowledgeable sommeliers. Tickets start at just $33 (price will go up as event gets closer).  

PREPAY ONLY EVENT. Must purchase ticket in advance at this link below (limited space and no tickets sold at door) - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/wine414/dates/Oct-27-2015_at_0630PM

What kinds of wine/apps?  24 whites, reds, sparklers, rose's, & dessert wines. These wines will not disappoint, and will amaze you with their unique flavors, styles, and mineralities. A super tasting from an incredible wine region! Complimentary cheeses, dips, olives, & flatbreads will be served. 

Can I come alone?  Yes 90%  attending come on their own. 

Do I need to know about wine? No, most come for socializing, learning and the enjoyment of wine.

What's dress code? Wear what you had on at work.  It is a casual and comfortable atmosphere. 

Who will be there? This is a multi-Meetup event so don't just go by RSVP's here. There will be 40+ others there.

What are the ages?  This is non-age specific event.  We'll have a good mix of ages 20s-50s. Everyone always seems to find people in their peer group to hang and taste with. 

Do I have to buy a ticket in advance?  Yes.  Space is limited and this will sell out. An RSVP alone will not hold your spot. You must purchase a ticket at this link to be confirmed - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/wine414/dates/Oct-27-2015_at_0630PM
results.name: Wine Tasting Social - Enjoy 24 Wines + Light Apps (PREPAY ONLY) Last one of year

What kinds of wine/apps?  24 whites, reds, sparklers, rose's, & dessert wines. These wines will not disappoint, and will amaze you with their unique flavors, styles, and mineralities. A super tasting from an incredible wine region! Complimentary cheeses, dips, olives, & flatbreads will be served. 

Can I come alone?  Yes 90%  attending come on their own. 

Do I need to know about wine? No, most come for socializing, learning and the enjoyment of wine.

What's dress code? Wear what you had on at work.  It is a casual and comfortable atmosphere. 

Who will be there? This is a multi-Meetup event so don't just go by RSVP's here. There will be 40+ others there.

What are the ages?  This is non-age specific event.  We'll have a good mix of ages 20s-50s. Everyone always seems to find people in their peer group to hang and taste with.

results.description:
Class Tuesday night 6:30-8:30pm.
Intercambio is an “exchange” (as translated in English) of language and culture in a friendly atmosphere. The primary purpose is to provide an open forum for both English and Spanish learners to practice their conversational skills with native speakers. Intercambio is an essential compliment to formal language study, as it exposes participants to everyday dialects, idiomatic expressions and usages that are best explained by a native speaker.
Everyone is welcome!
results.name: Intercambio - Spanish/English language exchange!!

• Guys- Limited space still available!  Register asap

Prepayment is required--http://www.weekenddating.com/upcoming.shtml?eventid=5931

------------------------------------------------ 
WHAT: Speed BOWLING NYC- AGES 20's, 30's, 40's (prepay required)


WHERE: Bowlmor Times Square 
WHO: AGES 20's, 30's, 40's (prepay required)

How it works

Women will be paired up into teams of two or three and Men will be paired up into teams of three. We will have one male team and one female team stationed at each bowling lane. This male and female team (known as a group) will combine to bowl one 10 frame game. Remember, you are not bowling an entire game yourself. This is a group effort. A person from the female team will bowl a frame. Next, a member of the male team will bowl a frame. Then female number two bowls a frame followed by male number two. The process continues until all ten frames are bowled. During this time all of the members of the group will be getting to know each other. Which ever group has the highest score at the end of each game will win a prize. Please visit http://www.weekenddating.com/bowling.shtml for full details on this special format and scorecard matching.

-------------------------------------------------------------------------

Cost: $35.75

results.description:
Hey! This month me and Jack, from Growth Hackers NYC, will be doing a quick chat on some of our latest hacks and some that we've noticed from other companies. We will teach you some of the magic behind growing social accounts FAST and some other fun PR hacks. There will be a Q&A and community shout outs afterwards!

Mostly, we want people to get to know each other and see how we can all build a great community together. Beer, wine, and pizza will be provided. The learning segment of the meetup will only be around 30 minutes long to allow people to mingle.

See you there!

Thank you to our sponsors:

Startup Institute was created and designed by Techstars, and is a community and mentorship-driven accelerator that helps new entrepreneurs join high-growth companies. With offices in NYC,Chicago, London and Berlin, there are more than 1000 alumni worldwide already with more graduating all the time. The Startup Institute is building “Neighborhoods” of entrepreneurial and diverse tech communities around the world. 

Rise New York is a collaborative co-working community shaping the future of commerce and fintech by helping startups and entrepreneurs connect, co-create, and scale innovation. In partnership with Barclays, they listen, nurture and oxygenate through their international network of Rise co-working hubs. Rise New York also houses a world-class event space and is home to the first U.S. cohort of the Barclays Accelerator, powered by Techstars. Oh, and they leave the front door open for the curious…Contact them at [masked].

Collectively, they are a global phenomenon of old and new world beer drinkers from the first settlements of Maspeth, Flushing & Jamaica. They are small business owners hailing the streets of Jackson Heights, Long Island City & Astoria pursuing the Queensmerican dream. They are die-hard Mets fans, not fully understanding the meaning of 7th-inning-stretch, huddled together at the Cuckoo’s Nest for 10 innings of Game 6. They are Queens Brewery, The Melting Barrel.
results.name: Growthhacking Tips and Network Hack

Join us for our first Happy Hour Event to unwind and socialize, and meet with dating expert and therapist, Natalia De Oliveira – NYC Relationship Coach. 

During this fun, cozy time, she will give you insights about where and how to meet people in the City, and ways to stand out and get the attention you deserve.

This will be the perfect moment to get real great NYC dating tips while enjoying a cool, laid-back atmosphere.

You'll get: 

- Memorable Advice and Tips about Dating in NYC

- Happy Hour Specials: 

$10 Absolut 

$8 Wine 

$6 Draft

- A chance to Mingle with other NYC singles

Prepare your questions… Natalia will go on mini one-on-one session with members who are willing to it.

Be inspired to be attractive!

Note: The Event will take place on the Rooftop. 

Bring your ID and your brightest smile!

A little note about Natalia

Natalia is a seasoned Psychotherapist turned Dating and Relationship Coach. Natalia’s objective through TheRelationshipCoach, LLC is to empower adults in the love department and help them find compatible matches. Natalia provides a range of personal relationship services, including: in-person or virtual coaching sessions, online dating profile assistance, real-time advice via text (to help you figure out what he/she meant when they introduced you to their family as “a friend”), and even being your wingman for a happy hour. You can rely on her to provide objectivity, advice that is logically and emotionally balanced, and empowerment to ask for more from your relationships.

With both a BA and an MA in Psychology, she takes an evolutionary psychology and physical anthropology based standpoint when studying romantic love and mating behaviors.

You can follow her on twitter @NYCTRC or Instagram Natid27
results.name: How and Where to Meet and Attract People in the NYC? - Happy Hour Event

results.description:
Since its announcement in May 2014, Xamarin.Forms has excited the development community by allowing C# programmers to write cross-platform mobile applications that run on iOS, Android, and Windows Phone devices. Using both C# and XAML, programmers construct user interfaces and supporting code with a platform-independent API that then maps to native controls on these three platforms.

But Xamarin is also enthusiastic about F#. Although there is not yet a Visual Studio project template for directly creating Xamarin.Forms applications in F#, it's fairly easy to make hybrid C# and F# solutions that let you write the bulk of your application code in F#.

Join Charles Petzold in a code-heavy presentation as he demonstrates this technique, while also exploring some of the concepts and power of F#, including recursion, piping, and asynchronous processing.


Speaker

Charles Petzold is the author of several books on Windows programming, most notably Programming Windows, currently in its 6th edition and covering the Windows Runtime API. He is also the author of two books on the conceptual foundations of computing technology: Code: The Hidden Language of Computer Hardware and Software (Microsoft Press, 1999) and The Annotated Turing: A Guided Tour through Alan Turing's Historic Paper on Computability and the Turing Machine (Wiley, 2008)


Petzold is an employee of Xamarin where he is writing the book Creating Mobile Apps with Xamarin.Forms, available as a free download from xamarin.com. His web site is www.charlespetzold.com.

Note: this is a joint meeting with the Microsoft Mobile App Developers group

Pizza will be provided courtesy of Xamarin
results.how_to_find_us: 6th Floor: Radio City
results.name: Programming Xamarin.Forms Apps in F#
